[I]79-emma see no sign of attachment — [I]79-emma believe nothing of the pianoforte — and proof only shall convince [me]79-emma that [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley has any thought of marrying [Jane Fairfax]142-miss fairfax . ”[79-emma] [They]1911-them combated the point some time longer in the same way ; [Emma]79-emma rather gaining ground over the mind of [[her]79-emma friend]417-her friend ; for [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston was the most used of [the two]1913-the two to yield ; till a little bustle in [the room]3386-the room shewed [them]1911-them that tea was over , and the instrument in preparation;—and at the same moment [Mr. Cole]135-mr. cole approaching to entreat [Miss Woodhouse]80-miss taylor would do [them]1911-them the honour of trying it . [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill , of whom , in the eagerness of [her]79-emma conversation with [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston , [she]79-emma had been seeing nothing , except that [he]98-frank churchill had found a seat by [Miss Fairfax]142-miss fairfax , followed [Mr. Cole]135-mr. cole , to add [his]98-frank churchill very pressing entreaties ; and as , in every respect , it suited [Emma]79-emma best to lead , [she]79-emma gave a very proper compliance . [She]79-emma knew the limitations of [her]79-emma own powers too well to attempt more than [she]79-emma could perform with credit ; [she]79-emma wanted neither taste nor spirit in the little things which are generally acceptable , and could accompany [her]79-emma own voice well . One accompaniment to [her]79-emma song took [her]79-emma agreeably by surprize — a second , slightly but correctly taken by [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill . [Her]79-emma pardon was duly begged at the close of the song , and every thing usual followed . [He]98-frank churchill was accused of having a delightful voice , and a perfect knowledge of music ; which was properly denied ; and that [he]98-frank churchill knew nothing of the matter , and had no voice at all , roundly asserted . [They]1915-they sang together once more ; and [Emma]79-emma would then resign [her]79-emma place to [Miss Fairfax]142-miss fairfax , whose performance , both vocal and instrumental , [she]79-emma never could attempt to conceal from [herself]79-emma , was infinitely superior to [her]79-emma own . With mixed feelings , [she]79-emma seated [herself]79-emma at a little distance from the numbers round the instrument , to listen . [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill sang again . [They]1915-they had sung together once or twice , it appeared , at [Weymouth]26-weymouth . But the sight of [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley among the most attentive , soon drew away half [Emma]79-emma ’s mind ; and [she]79-emma fell into a train of thinking on the subject of [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston ’s suspicions , to which the sweet sounds of the united voices gave only momentary interruptions . [Her]79-emma objections to [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley ’s marrying did not in the least subside . [She]79-emma could see nothing but evil in it . It would be a great disappointment to [Mr. John Knightley]88-mr. knightley ; consequently to [Isabella]83-isabella . A real injury to [the children]3286-the children — a most mortifying change , and material loss to [them]3286-the children all;—a very great deduction from [[her]79-emma father]415-her father ’s daily comfort — and , as to [herself]79-emma , [she]79-emma could not at all endure the idea of [Jane Fairfax]142-miss fairfax at [Donwell Abbey]202-donwell . [A Mrs. Knightley]117-mrs. john knightley for [them]3286-the children all to give way to!—No — [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley must never marry . [Little Henry]118-henry must remain [the heir of [Donwell]202-donwell]1918-the heir of donwell . Presently [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley looked back , and came and sat down by [her]79-emma . [They]1919-they talked at first only of the performance . [His]88-mr. knightley admiration was certainly very warm ; yet [she]79-emma thought , but for [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston , it would not have struck [her]79-emma . As a sort of touchstone , however , [she]79-emma began to speak of [his]88-mr. knightley kindness in conveying [the aunt and niece]1920-the aunt and niece ; and though [his]88-mr. knightley answer was in the spirit of cutting the matter short , [she]79-emma believed it to indicate only [his]88-mr. knightley disinclination to dwell on any kindness of [his]88-mr. knightley own . “ [I]79-emma often feel concern , ”[79-emma] said [she]79-emma , “ that [I]79-emma dare not make [our]1919-they carriage more useful on such occasions . It is not that [I]79-emma am without the wish ; but [you]4260-you know how impossible [[my]79-emma father]3146-my father would deem it that [James]86-james should put - to for such a purpose . ”[79-emma] “ Quite out of the question , quite out of the question , ”[88-mr. knightley] [he]88-mr. knightley replied;—“but [you]79-emma must often wish it , [I]88-mr. knightley am sure . ”[88-mr. knightley] And [he]88-mr. knightley smiled with such seeming pleasure at the conviction , that [she]79-emma must proceed another step . “ This present from [the Campbells]180-the campbells , ”[88-mr. knightley] said she—“this pianoforte is very kindly given . ”[79-emma] “ Yes , ”[88-mr. knightley] [he]88-mr. knightley replied , and without the smallest apparent embarrassment.—“But [they]1919-they would have done better had [they]1919-they given [her]79-emma notice of it . [Surprizes]211-surprizes are foolish things . The pleasure is not enhanced , and the inconvenience is often considerable . [I]88-mr. knightley should have expected better judgment in [Colonel Campbell]153-colonel campbell . ”[88-mr. knightley] From that moment , [Emma]79-emma could have taken [her]79-emma oath that [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley had had no concern in giving the instrument . But whether [he]88-mr. knightley were entirely free from peculiar attachment — whether there were no actual preference — remained a little longer doubtful . Towards the end of [Jane]142-miss fairfax ’s second song , [her]142-miss fairfax voice grew thick . “ That will do , ”[88-mr. knightley] said [he]88-mr. knightley , when it was finished , thinking aloud—“you have sung quite enough for one evening — now be quiet . ”[88-mr. knightley] Another song , however , was soon begged for . “ One more;—they would not fatigue [Miss Fairfax]142-miss fairfax on any account , and would only ask for one more . ”[88-mr. knightley] And [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill was heard to say , “ [I]98-frank churchill think [you]142-miss fairfax could manage this without effort ; the first part is so very trifling . The strength of the song falls on the second . ”[98-frank churchill] [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley grew angry . “ [That fellow]4262-that fellow , ”[88-mr. knightley] said [he]88-mr. knightley , indignantly , “ thinks of nothing but [shewing]4263-shewing off [his]4262-that fellow own voice . This must not be . ”[88-mr. knightley] And touching [Miss Bates]101-miss bates , who at that moment passed [near—“Miss Bates]101-miss bates , are [you]101-miss bates mad , to let [[your]101-miss bates niece]4264-your niece sing [herself]4264-your niece hoarse in this manner ? Go , and interfere . [They]4265-they have no mercy on [her]4264-your niece . ”[101-miss bates] [Miss Bates]101-miss bates , in [her]101-miss bates real anxiety for [Jane]101-miss bates , could hardly stay even to be grateful , before [she]101-miss bates stept forward and put an end to all farther singing . Here ceased the concert part of the evening , for [Miss Woodhouse]80-miss taylor and [Miss Fairfax]142-miss fairfax were [the only young lady performers]1921-the only young lady performers ; but soon ( within five minutes ) the proposal of dancing — originating [nobody]3124-nobody exactly knew where — was so effectually promoted by [Mr.]1923-mr. and [Mrs. Cole]176-mrs. cole , that every thing was rapidly clearing away , to give proper space . [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston , capital in [her]84-mrs. weston country - dances , was seated , and beginning an irresistible waltz ; and [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill , coming up with most becoming gallantry to [Emma]79-emma , had secured [her]79-emma hand , and led [her]79-emma up to the top . While waiting till [the other young people]1924-the other young people could pair [themselves]1924-the other young people off , [Emma]79-emma found time , in spite of the compliments [she]79-emma was receiving on [her]79-emma voice and [her]79-emma taste , to look about , and see what became of [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley . This would be a trial . [He]88-mr. knightley was [no dancer in general]1925-no dancer in general . If [he]88-mr. knightley were to be very alert in engaging [Jane Fairfax]142-miss fairfax now , it might augur something . There was no immediate appearance . No ; [he]88-mr. knightley was talking to [Mrs. Cole]176-mrs. cole — [he]88-mr. knightley was looking on unconcerned ; [Jane]142-miss fairfax was asked by [somebody else]1926-somebody else , and [he]88-mr. knightley was still talking to [Mrs. Cole]176-mrs. cole . [Emma]79-emma had no longer an alarm for [Henry]118-henry ; [his]88-mr. knightley interest was yet safe ; and [she]79-emma led off the dance with genuine spirit and enjoyment . Not more than [five couple]1927-five couple could be mustered ; but the rarity and the suddenness of it made it very delightful , and [she]79-emma found [herself]79-emma well matched in [a partner]1928-a partner . [They]1929-they were [a couple worth looking at]1930-a couple worth looking at . Two dances , unfortunately , were all that could be allowed . It was growing late , and [Miss Bates]101-miss bates became anxious to get [home]3258-home , on [[her]101-miss bates mother]399-her mother ’s account . After some attempts , therefore , to be permitted to begin again , [they]1929-they were obliged to thank [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston , look sorrowful , and have done . “ Perhaps it is as well , ”[98-frank churchill] said [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill , as [he]98-frank churchill attended [Emma]79-emma to [[her]79-emma carriage]1933-her carriage . “ [I]98-frank churchill must have asked [Miss Fairfax]142-miss fairfax , and [her]142-miss fairfax languid dancing would not have agreed with [me]98-frank churchill , after [yours]4266-yours . ”[98-frank churchill] [CHAPTER IX Emma]79-emma did not repent [her]79-emma condescension in going to [the Coles]175-the coles . The visit afforded [her]79-emma many pleasant recollections the next day ; and all that [she]79-emma might be supposed to have lost on the side of dignified seclusion , must be amply repaid in the splendour of popularity . [She]79-emma must have delighted [the Coles]175-the coles — [worthy people , who deserved to be made happy!—And]1934-worthy people , who deserved to be made happy!—and left a name behind [her]79-emma that would not soon die away . Perfect happiness , even in memory , is not common ; and there were two points on which [she]79-emma was not quite easy . [She]79-emma doubted whether [she]79-emma had not transgressed the duty of [woman]3428-woman by [woman]3428-woman , in betraying [her]79-emma suspicions of [Jane Fairfax]142-miss fairfax ’s feelings to [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill . It was hardly right ; but it had been so strong an idea , that it would escape [her]79-emma , and [his]98-frank churchill submission to all that [she]79-emma told , was a compliment to [her]79-emma penetration , which made it difficult for [her]79-emma to be quite certain that [she]79-emma ought to have held [her]79-emma tongue . The other circumstance of regret related also to [Jane Fairfax]142-miss fairfax ; and there [she]79-emma had no doubt . [She]79-emma did unfeignedly and unequivocally regret the inferiority of [her]79-emma own playing and singing . [She]79-emma did most heartily grieve over the idleness of [her]79-emma childhood — and sat down and practised vigorously an hour and a half . [She]79-emma was then interrupted by [Harriet]107-harriet ’s coming in ; and if [Harriet]107-harriet ’s praise could have satisfied [her]79-emma , [she]79-emma might soon have been comforted . “ Oh ! if [I]107-harriet could but play as well as [you]107-harriet and [Miss Fairfax]142-miss fairfax ! ”[107-harriet] “ Do n’t class [us]4267-us together , [Harriet]107-harriet . [My]107-harriet playing is no more like [her]142-miss fairfax ’s , than a lamp is like sunshine . ”[107-harriet] “ Oh ! dear — [I]107-harriet think [you]107-harriet play the best of the two . [I]107-harriet think [you]107-harriet play quite as well as [she]142-miss fairfax does . [I]107-harriet am sure [I]107-harriet had much rather hear [you]107-harriet . [Every body last night]4268-every body last night said how well [you]107-harriet played . ”[107-harriet] “ [Those who knew any thing about it]4269-those who knew any thing about it , must have felt the difference . The truth is , [Harriet]107-harriet , that [my]107-harriet playing is just good enough to be praised , but [Jane Fairfax]142-miss fairfax ’s is much beyond it . ”[107-harriet] “ Well , [I]107-harriet always shall think that [you]107-harriet play quite as well as [she]142-miss fairfax does , or that if there is any difference [nobody]3124-nobody would ever find it out . [Mr. Cole]135-mr. cole said how much taste [you]107-harriet had ; and [Mr. Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill talked a great deal about [your]107-harriet taste , and that [he]98-frank churchill valued taste much more than execution . ”[107-harriet] “ Ah ! but [Jane Fairfax]142-miss fairfax has [them]4271-them both , [Harriet]107-harriet . ”[107-harriet] “ Are [you]107-harriet sure ? [I]107-harriet saw [she]142-miss fairfax had execution , but [I]107-harriet did not know [she]142-miss fairfax had any taste . [Nobody]3124-nobody talked about it . And [I]107-harriet hate [Italian singing.—There]213-italian singing.—there is no understanding a word of it . Besides , if [she]142-miss fairfax does play so very well , [you]107-harriet know , it is no more than [she]142-miss fairfax is obliged to do , because [she]142-miss fairfax will have to teach . [The Coxes]214-the coxes were wondering last night whether [she]142-miss fairfax would get into [any great family]4273-any great family . How did [you]107-harriet think [the Coxes]214-the coxes looked ? ”[107-harriet] “ Just as [they]214-the coxes always do — very vulgar . ”[107-harriet] “ [They]1937-they told [me]107-harriet something , ”[107-harriet] said [Harriet]107-harriet rather hesitatingly ; “ but it is nothing of any consequence . ”[107-harriet] [Emma]79-emma was obliged to ask what [they]1937-they had told [her]79-emma , though fearful of its producing [Mr. Elton]91-mr. elton . “ [They]1937-they told [me]91-mr. elton — that [Mr. Martin]112-mr. martin dined with [them]1937-they last Saturday . ”[91-mr. elton] “ Oh ! ”[107-harriet] “ [He]112-mr. martin came to [[their]1937-they father]995-their father upon some business , and [he]112-mr. martin asked [him]112-mr. martin to stay to dinner . ”[107-harriet] “ Oh ! ”[91-mr. elton] “ [They]1937-they talked a great deal about [him]112-mr. martin , especially [Anne Cox]215-anne cox . Another accidental meeting with [the Martins]110-the martins was possible , and in [her]107-harriet present state , would be dangerous . [Harriet]107-harriet , tempted by every thing and swayed by half a word , was always very long at a purchase ; and while [she]107-harriet was still hanging over muslins and changing [her]107-harriet mind , [Emma]79-emma went to the door for amusement.—Much could not be hoped from the traffic of even [the busiest part of [Highbury;—Mr]51-highbury;—mr]1938-the busiest part of highbury;—mr . A mind lively and at ease , can do with seeing nothing , and can see nothing that does not answer . [She]79-emma looked down [the Randalls road]1946-the randalls road . [Emma]79-emma watched [them]1952-them in , and then joined [Harriet]107-harriet at the interesting counter,—trying , with all the force of [her]107-harriet own mind , to convince [her]107-harriet that if [she]107-harriet wanted plain muslin it was of no use to look at figured ; and that a blue ribbon , be it ever so beautiful , would still never match [her]107-harriet yellow pattern . [[My]79-emma mother]1513-my mother is delightfully well ; and [Jane]142-miss fairfax caught no cold last night . How is [Mr. Woodhouse?—I]4298-mr. woodhouse?—i am so glad to hear such a good account . [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston told [me]79-emma [you]90-hartfield were here.—Oh ! then , said [I]79-emma , [I]79-emma must run across , [I]79-emma am sure [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield will allow [me]79-emma just to run across and entreat [her]90-hartfield to come in ; [[my]79-emma mother]1513-my mother will be so very happy to see [her]90-hartfield — and now [we]4300-we are such a nice party , [she]90-hartfield can not refuse.—‘Aye , pray do , ’ said [Mr. Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill , ‘ [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield ’s opinion of the instrument will be worth having . ’—But , said [I]79-emma , [I]79-emma shall be more sure of succeeding if one of [you]90-hartfield will go with me.—‘Oh , ’ said [he]98-frank churchill , ‘ wait half a minute , till [I]79-emma have finished [my]79-emma job;’—For , would [you]90-hartfield believe it , [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield , there [he]98-frank churchill is , in the most obliging manner in [the world]392-the world , fastening in the rivet of [[my]79-emma mother]1513-my mother ’s spectacles.—The rivet came out , [you]90-hartfield know , this morning.—So very obliging!—For [[my]79-emma mother]1513-my mother had no use of [her]1513-my mother spectacles — could not put them on . And , by the bye , [every body]3270-every body ought to have two pair of spectacles ; they should indeed . [Jane]142-miss fairfax said so . [I]79-emma meant to take them over to [John Saunders]221-john saunders the first thing [I]79-emma did , but something or other hindered [me]79-emma all the morning ; first one thing , then another , there is no saying what , [you]90-hartfield know . At one time [Patty]185-patty came to say [she]185-patty thought [the kitchen chimney]4305-the kitchen chimney wanted sweeping . Oh , said [I]79-emma , [Patty]185-patty do not come with [your]90-hartfield bad news to [me]79-emma . Here is the rivet of [[your]90-hartfield mistress]4306-your mistress ’s spectacles out . Then the baked apples came [home]3258-home , [Mrs. Wallis]222-mrs. wallis sent [them]4308-them by [[her]222-mrs. wallis boy]4309-her boy ; [they]4308-them are extremely civil and obliging to [us]4310-our , [the Wallises]4311-the wallises , always — [I]79-emma have heard [some people]3167-some people say that [Mrs. Wallis]222-mrs. wallis can be uncivil and give a very rude answer , but [we]4310-our have never known any thing but the greatest attention from [them]3167-some people . And it can not be for the value of [our]4310-our custom now , for what is [our]4310-our consumption of bread , [you]90-hartfield know ? [Only three of [us.—besides]4314-us.—besides dear [Jane]142-miss fairfax]4313-only three of us.—besides dear jane at present — and [she]142-miss fairfax really eats nothing — makes such a shocking breakfast , [you]90-hartfield would be quite frightened if [you]90-hartfield saw it . [I]79-emma dare not let [[my]79-emma mother]1513-my mother know how little [she]142-miss fairfax eats — so [I]79-emma say one thing and then [I]79-emma say another , and it passes off . But about the middle of the day [she]142-miss fairfax gets hungry , and there is nothing [she]142-miss fairfax likes so well as these baked apples , and they are extremely wholesome , for [I]79-emma took the opportunity the other day of asking [Mr. Perry]102-mr. perry ; [I]79-emma happened to meet [him]102-mr. perry in [the street]3836-the street . Not that [I]79-emma had any doubt before — [I]79-emma have so often heard [Mr. Woodhouse]81-mr. woodhouse recommend a baked apple . [I]79-emma believe it is the only way that [Mr. Woodhouse]81-mr. woodhouse thinks the fruit thoroughly wholesome . [We]1956-they have apple - dumplings , however , very often . [Patty]185-patty makes an excellent apple - dumpling . And [I]101-miss bates am sure , by [his]98-frank churchill manner , it was no compliment . Indeed they are very delightful apples , and [Mrs. Wallis]222-mrs. wallis does [them]4324-them full justice — only [we]4322-we do not have them baked more than twice , and [Mr. Woodhouse]81-mr. woodhouse made [us]4322-we promise to have them done three times — but [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield will be so good as not to mention it . The apples themselves are the very finest sort for baking , beyond a doubt ; all from [Donwell]202-donwell — some of [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley ’s most liberal supply . [He]88-mr. knightley sends [us]4322-we a sack every year ; and certainly there never was such a keeping apple anywhere as one of [his]88-mr. knightley trees — [I]101-miss bates believe there is two of them . [[My]101-miss bates mother]1513-my mother says [the orchard]4326-the orchard was always famous in [her]1513-my mother younger days . But [I]101-miss bates was really quite shocked the other day — for [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley called one morning , and [Jane]101-miss bates was eating these apples , and [we]4322-we talked about them and said how much [she]101-miss bates enjoyed them , and [he]88-mr. knightley asked whether [we]4322-we were not got to the end of [our]4322-we stock . ‘ [I]101-miss bates am sure [you]101-miss bates must be , ’ said [he]88-mr. knightley , ‘ and [I]101-miss bates will send [you]101-miss bates another supply ; for [I]101-miss bates have a great many more than [I]101-miss bates can ever use . [William Larkins]223-william larkins let [me]101-miss bates keep a larger quantity than usual this year . [I]101-miss bates will send [you]101-miss bates some more , before [they]4327-they get good for nothing . ’ So [I]101-miss bates begged [he]88-mr. knightley would not — for really as to [ours]4322-we being gone , [I]101-miss bates could not absolutely say that [we]4322-we had a great many left — it was but half a dozen indeed ; but they should be all kept for [Jane]101-miss bates ; and [I]101-miss bates could not at all bear that [he]88-mr. knightley should be sending [us]4322-we more , so liberal as [he]88-mr. knightley had been already ; and [Jane]101-miss bates said the same . And when [he]88-mr. knightley was gone , [she]101-miss bates almost quarrelled with [me]101-miss bates — No , [I]101-miss bates should not say quarrelled , for [we]4322-we never had a quarrel in [our]4322-we lives ; but [she]101-miss bates was quite distressed that [I]101-miss bates had owned the apples were so nearly gone ; [she]101-miss bates wished [I]101-miss bates had made [him]88-mr. knightley believe [we]4322-we had a great many left . [She]224-mrs. hodges could not bear that [[her]224-mrs. hodges master]4336-her master should not be able to have another apple - tart this spring . [He]4331-his master told [Patty]185-patty this , but bid [her]185-patty not mind it , and be sure not to say any thing to [us]4337-us about it , for [Mrs. Hodges]224-mrs. hodges would be cross sometimes , and as long as so many sacks were sold , it did not signify who ate the remainder . And so [Patty]185-patty told [me]101-miss bates , and [I]101-miss bates was excessively shocked indeed ! [Miss Smith]107-harriet , the step at the turning . ”[101-miss bates] CHAPTER X The appearance of [the little sitting - room]1961-the little sitting - room as [they]1962-they entered , was tranquillity itself ; [Mrs. Bates]106-mrs. bates , deprived of [her]106-mrs. bates usual employment , slumbering on one side of the fire , [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill , at a table near [her]106-mrs. bates , most deedily occupied about [her]106-mrs. bates spectacles , and [Jane Fairfax]142-miss fairfax , standing with [her]142-miss fairfax back to [them]1962-they , intent on [her]142-miss fairfax pianoforte . Busy as [he]1963-i was , however , [the young man]3228-the young man was yet able to shew a most happy countenance on seeing [Emma]79-emma again . “ This is a pleasure , ”[1963-i] said [he]1963-i , in rather a low voice , “ coming at least ten minutes earlier than [I]1963-i had calculated . [You]84-mrs. weston find [me]1963-i trying to be useful ; tell [me]1963-i if [you]84-mrs. weston think [I]1963-i shall succeed . ”[1963-i] “ What ! ”[84-mrs. weston] said [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston , “ have not [you]1963-i finished it yet ? [you]1963-i would not earn a very good livelihood as [a working silversmith]4340-a working silversmith at this rate . ”[84-mrs. weston] “ [I]1963-i have not been working uninterruptedly , ”[1963-i] [he]1963-i replied , “ [I]1963-i have been assisting [Miss Fairfax]142-miss fairfax in trying to make [her]142-miss fairfax instrument stand steadily , it was not quite firm ; an unevenness in the floor , [I]1963-i believe . [You]84-mrs. weston see [we]4341-we have been wedging one leg with paper . This was very kind of [you]84-mrs. weston to be persuaded to come . [I]1963-i was almost afraid [you]84-mrs. weston would be hurrying [home]3258-home . ”[1963-i] [He]1963-i contrived that [she]84-mrs. weston should be seated by [him]1963-i ; and was sufficiently employed in looking out the best baked apple for [her]84-mrs. weston , and trying to make [her]84-mrs. weston help or advise [him]1963-i in [his]1963-i work , till [Jane Fairfax]142-miss fairfax was quite ready to sit down to the pianoforte again . That [she]142-miss fairfax was not immediately ready , [Emma]79-emma did suspect to arise from the state of [her]79-emma nerves ; [she]79-emma had not yet possessed the instrument long enough to touch it without emotion ; [she]79-emma must reason [herself]79-emma into the power of performance ; and [Emma]79-emma could not but pity such feelings , whatever their origin , and could not but resolve never to expose them to [[her]79-emma neighbour]1855-her neighbour again . At last [Jane]142-miss fairfax began , and though the first bars were feebly given , the powers of the instrument were gradually done full justice to . [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston had been delighted before , and was delighted again ; [Emma]79-emma joined [her]84-mrs. weston in all [her]84-mrs. weston praise ; and the pianoforte , with every proper discrimination , was pronounced to be altogether of the highest promise . “ Whoever [Colonel Campbell]153-colonel campbell might employ , ”[98-frank churchill] said [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill , with a smile at [Emma]79-emma , “ [the person]4190-the person has not chosen ill . [I]98-frank churchill heard a good deal of [Colonel Campbell]153-colonel campbell ’s taste at [Weymouth]26-weymouth ; and the softness of the upper notes [I]98-frank churchill am sure is exactly what [he]153-colonel campbell and [all that party]4344-all that party would particularly prize . [I]98-frank churchill dare say , [Miss Fairfax]142-miss fairfax , that [he]153-colonel campbell either gave [[his]153-colonel campbell friend]3473-his friend very minute directions , or wrote to [Broadwood]49-broadwood [himself]153-colonel campbell . Do not [you]142-miss fairfax think so ? ”[98-frank churchill] [Jane]142-miss fairfax did not look round . [She]142-miss fairfax was not obliged to hear . [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston had been speaking to [her]142-miss fairfax at the same moment . “ It is not fair , ”[79-emma] said [Emma]79-emma , in a whisper ; “ mine was a random guess . Do not distress [her]142-miss fairfax . ”[79-emma] [He]1966-he shook [his]1966-he head with a smile , and looked as if [he]1966-he had very little doubt and very little mercy . Soon afterwards [he]1966-he began again , “ How much [[your]142-miss fairfax friends in [Ireland]34-ireland]4346-your friends in ireland must be enjoying [your]142-miss fairfax pleasure on this occasion , [Miss Fairfax]142-miss fairfax . [I]1966-he dare say [they]4346-your friends in ireland often think of [you]142-miss fairfax , and wonder which will be the day , the precise day of the instrument ’s coming to hand . Do [you]142-miss fairfax imagine [Colonel Campbell]153-colonel campbell knows the business to be going forward just at this time?—Do [you]142-miss fairfax imagine it to be the consequence of an immediate commission from [him]153-colonel campbell , or that [he]153-colonel campbell may have sent only a general direction , an order indefinite as to time , to depend upon contingencies and conveniences ? ”[1966-he] [He]1966-he paused . [She]1967-she could not but hear ; [she]1967-she could not avoid answering , “ Till [I]1967-she have a letter from [Colonel Campbell]153-colonel campbell , ”[1967-she] said [she]1967-she , in a voice of forced calmness , “ [I]1967-she can imagine nothing with any confidence . [I]1968-i wish [I]1968-i could conjecture how soon [I]1968-i shall make this rivet quite firm . What [nonsense one]4348-nonsense one talks , [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield , when hard at work , if [one]475-one talks at [all;—your real workmen]4350-all;—your real workmen , [I]1968-i suppose , hold [their]4350-all;—your real workmen tongues ; but [we]4351-we gentlemen labourers if [we]4351-we get hold of a word — [Miss Fairfax]142-miss fairfax said something about conjecturing . There , it is done . [I]1968-i have the pleasure , [madam]1401-madam , ( to [Mrs. Bates]106-mrs. bates , ) of restoring [your]1401-madam spectacles , healed for the present . ”[1968-i] [He]1968-i was very warmly thanked both by [mother]1537-mother and [daughter]3344-daughter ; to escape a little from the latter , [he]1968-i went to the pianoforte , and begged [Miss Fairfax]142-miss fairfax , who was still sitting at it , to play something more . “ If [you]1401-madam are very kind , ”[1968-i] said [he]1968-i , “ it will be one of the waltzes [we]4351-we danced last night;—let [me]142-miss fairfax live them over again . [You]1401-madam did not enjoy them as [I]142-miss fairfax did ; [you]1401-madam appeared tired the whole time . [I]142-miss fairfax believe [you]1401-madam were glad [we]4351-we danced no longer ; but [I]142-miss fairfax would have given [worlds]4353-worlds — all the worlds [one]475-one ever has to give — for another half - hour . ”[142-miss fairfax] [She]142-miss fairfax played . “ What felicity it is to hear a tune again which has made one happy!—If [I]142-miss fairfax mistake not that was danced at [Weymouth]26-weymouth . ”[142-miss fairfax] [She]142-miss fairfax looked up at [him]1968-i for a moment , coloured deeply , and played something else . [He]1968-i took some music from a chair near the pianoforte , and turning to [Emma]79-emma , said , “ Here is something quite new to [me]1968-i . Do [you]79-emma know it?—Cramer.—And here are a new set of Irish melodies . That , from such a quarter , [one]475-one might expect . This was all sent with the instrument . Very thoughtful of [Colonel Campbell]153-colonel campbell , was not it?—He knew [Miss Fairfax]142-miss fairfax could have no music [here]3113-here . [I]1968-i honour that part of the attention particularly ; it shews it to have been so thoroughly from the heart . Nothing hastily done ; nothing incomplete . True affection only could have prompted it . ”[1968-i] [Emma]79-emma wished [he]1968-i would be less pointed , yet could not help being amused ; and when on glancing [her]79-emma eye towards [Jane Fairfax]142-miss fairfax [she]79-emma caught the remains of a smile , when [she]79-emma saw that with all the deep blush of consciousness , there had been a smile of secret delight , [she]142-miss fairfax had less scruple in the amusement , and much less compunction with respect to her.—This amiable , upright , perfect [Jane Fairfax]142-miss fairfax was apparently cherishing very reprehensible feelings . [He]1968-i brought all the music to [her]79-emma , and [they]1971-they looked it over together.—Emma took the opportunity of whispering , “ [You]79-emma speak too plain . [She]142-miss fairfax must understand [you]79-emma . ”[1968-i] “ [I]1968-i hope [she]142-miss fairfax does . [I]1968-i would have [her]142-miss fairfax understand [me]1968-i . [I]1968-i am not in the least ashamed of [my]1968-i meaning . ”[1968-i] “ But really , [I]1968-i am half ashamed , and wish [I]1968-i had never taken up the idea . ”[1968-i] “ [I]1968-i am very glad [you]79-emma did , and that [you]79-emma communicated it to [me]1968-i . [I]1968-i have now a key to all [her]142-miss fairfax odd looks and ways . Leave shame to [her]142-miss fairfax . If [she]142-miss fairfax does wrong , [she]142-miss fairfax ought to feel it . ”[1968-i] “ [She]142-miss fairfax is not entirely without it , [I]1968-i think . ”[1968-i] “ [I]1968-i do not see much sign of it . [She]142-miss fairfax is playing [Robin Adair]226-robin adair at this moment — [his]88-mr. knightley favourite . ”[1968-i] Shortly afterwards [Miss Bates]101-miss bates , passing near the window , descried [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley on horse - back not far off . “ [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley [I]101-miss bates declare!—I must speak to [him]88-mr. knightley if possible , just to thank [him]88-mr. knightley . Can [I]88-mr. knightley do any thing for [you]101-miss bates ? ”[88-mr. knightley] “ Oh ! dear , [Kingston]15-kingston — are you?—Mrs . [Cole]135-mr. cole was saying the other day [she]4368-she wanted something from [Kingston]15-kingston . ”[88-mr. knightley] “ [Mrs. Cole]176-mrs. cole has [servants]1644-servants to send . Can [I]88-mr. knightley do any thing for [you]101-miss bates ? ”[88-mr. knightley] “ No , [I]88-mr. knightley thank [you]101-miss bates . But do come in . Who do [you]101-miss bates think is [here?—Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield and [Miss Smith]107-harriet ; so kind as to call to hear the new pianoforte . Do put up [your]101-miss bates horse at the Crown , and come in . ”[88-mr. knightley] “ Well , ”[88-mr. knightley] said [he]88-mr. knightley , in a deliberating manner , “ for five minutes , perhaps . ”[88-mr. knightley] “ And here is [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston and [Mr. Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill too!—Quite delightful ; [so many friends]4370-so many friends ! ”[88-mr. knightley] “ No , not now , [I]88-mr. knightley thank [you]101-miss bates . [I]88-mr. knightley could not stay two minutes . [I]88-mr. knightley must get on to [Kingston]15-kingston as fast as [I]88-mr. knightley can . ”[88-mr. knightley] “ Oh ! do come in . [They]1644-servants will be so very happy to see [you]101-miss bates . ”[88-mr. knightley] “ No , no ; [[your]101-miss bates room]4371-your room is full enough . [I]88-mr. knightley will call another day , and hear the pianoforte . ”[88-mr. knightley] “ Well , [I]88-mr. knightley am so sorry!—Oh ! [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley , what a delightful party last night ; how extremely pleasant.—Did [you]88-mr. knightley ever see such dancing?—Was not it delightful?—Miss [Woodhouse]90-hartfield and [Mr. Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill ; [I]88-mr. knightley never saw any thing equal to it . ”[88-mr. knightley] “ Oh ! very delightful indeed ; [I]88-mr. knightley can say nothing less , for [I]88-mr. knightley suppose [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield and [Mr. Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill are hearing every thing that passes . And ( raising [his]98-frank churchill voice still more ) [I]88-mr. knightley do not see why [Miss Fairfax]142-miss fairfax should not be mentioned too . [I]88-mr. knightley think [Miss Fairfax]142-miss fairfax dances very well ; and [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston is the very best country - dance player , without exception , in [England]38-england . Now , if [[your]88-mr. knightley friends]926-your friends have any gratitude , [they]926-your friends will say something pretty loud about [you]88-mr. knightley and [me]88-mr. knightley in return ; but [I]88-mr. knightley can not stay to hear it . ”[88-mr. knightley] “ Oh ! [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley , one moment more ; something of consequence — so shocked!—Jane and [I]88-mr. knightley are both so shocked about the apples ! ”[88-mr. knightley] “ What is the matter now ? ”[88-mr. knightley] “ To think of [your]88-mr. knightley sending [us]4373-we all [your]88-mr. knightley store apples . [You]88-mr. knightley said [you]88-mr. knightley had a great many , and now [you]88-mr. knightley have not one left . [We]4373-we really are so shocked ! [Mrs. Hodges]224-mrs. hodges may well be angry . [William Larkins]223-william larkins mentioned it here . [You]88-mr. knightley should not have done it , indeed [you]88-mr. knightley should not . Ah ! [he]223-william larkins is off . [He]223-william larkins never can bear to be thanked . But [I]88-mr. knightley thought [he]223-william larkins would have staid now , and it would have been a pity not to have mentioned .... Well , ( returning to [the room]3386-the room , ) [I]88-mr. knightley have not been able to succeed . [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley can not stop . [He]88-mr. knightley is going to [Kingston]15-kingston . [He]88-mr. knightley asked [me]88-mr. knightley if [he]88-mr. knightley could do any thing .... ”[88-mr. knightley] “ Yes , ”[142-miss fairfax] said [Jane]142-miss fairfax , “ [we]4373-we heard [his]88-mr. knightley kind offers , [we]4373-we heard every thing . ”[142-miss fairfax] “ Oh ! yes , [[my]88-mr. knightley dear]3120-my dear , [I]88-mr. knightley dare say [you]3120-my dear might , because [you]3120-my dear know , the door was open , and the window was open , and [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley spoke loud . [You]3120-my dear must have heard every thing to be sure . ‘ Can [I]88-mr. knightley do any thing for [you]3120-my dear at [Kingston]15-kingston ? ’ said [he]88-mr. knightley ; so [I]88-mr. knightley just mentioned .... Oh ! [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield , must [you]3120-my dear be going?—You seem but just come — so very obliging of [you]3120-my dear . ”[88-mr. knightley] [Emma]79-emma found it really time to be at [home]3258-home ; the visit had already lasted long ; and on examining watches , so much of the morning was perceived to be gone , that [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston and [[her]84-mrs. weston companion]3365-her companion taking leave also , could allow [themselves]1979-themselves only to walk with [the two young ladies]1980-the two young ladies to [[Hartfield]90-hartfield gates]1981-hartfield gates , before [they]1979-themselves set off for [Randalls]97-randalls . CHAPTER XI It may be possible to do without dancing entirely . Instances have been known of [young people]1597-young people passing many , many months successively , without being at any ball of any description , and no material injury accrue either to body or mind;—but when a beginning is made — when the felicities of rapid motion have once been , though slightly , felt — it must be a very heavy set that does not ask for more . [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill had danced once at [Highbury]3-highbury , and longed to dance again ; and the last half - hour of an evening which [Mr. Woodhouse]81-mr. woodhouse was persuaded to spend with [[his]81-mr. woodhouse daughter]3129-his daughter at [Randalls]97-randalls , was passed by [the two young people]1984-the two young people in schemes on the subject . [Frank]98-frank churchill ’s was the first idea ; and [his]81-mr. woodhouse the greatest zeal in pursuing it ; for [the lady]774-the lady was the best judge of the difficulties , and the most solicitous for accommodation and appearance . But still [she]774-the lady had inclination enough for [shewing people]1986-shewing people again how delightfully [Mr. Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill and [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield danced — for doing that in which [she]774-the lady need not blush to compare [herself]774-the lady with [Jane Fairfax]142-miss fairfax — and even for simple dancing itself , without any of the wicked aids of vanity — to assist [him]81-mr. woodhouse first in pacing out [the room [they]1984-the two young people were in]1987-the room they were in to see what it could be made to hold — and then in taking the dimensions of [the other parlour]1988-the other parlour , in the hope of discovering , in spite of all that [Mr. Weston]82-mr. weston could say of [their]1984-the two young people exactly equal size , that it was a little the largest . [His]82-mr. weston first proposition and request , that the dance begun at [Mr. Cole]135-mr. cole ’s should be finished [there]437-there — that [the same party]1990-the same party should be collected , and [the same musician]1991-the same musician engaged , met with the readiest acquiescence . [Mr. Weston]82-mr. weston entered into the idea with thorough enjoyment , and [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston most willingly undertook to play as long as [they]1984-the two young people could wish to dance ; and the interesting employment had followed , of reckoning up exactly who there would be , and portioning out the indispensable division of space to [every couple]1992-every couple . “ [You]82-mr. weston and [Miss Smith]107-harriet , and [Miss Fairfax]142-miss fairfax , will be three , and [the two Miss Coxes five]4376-the two miss coxes five , ”[1926-somebody else] had been repeated many times over . “ And there will be the two [Gilberts]229-gilberts , [young Cox]205-mr. cox , [[my]1926-somebody else father]3146-my father , and [myself]1926-somebody else , besides [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley . Yes , that will be quite enough for pleasure . [You]82-mr. weston and [Miss Smith]107-harriet , and [Miss Fairfax]142-miss fairfax , will be three , and [the two Miss Coxes five]4376-the two miss coxes five ; and for [five couple]1927-five couple there will be plenty of [room]4380-room . ”[1926-somebody else] But soon it came to be on one side , “ But will there be good room for five couple?—I really do not think there will . ”[1926-somebody else] On another , “ And after all , [five couple]1927-five couple are not enough to make it worth while to stand up . [Five couple]1927-five couple are nothing , when one thinks seriously about it . It will not do to invite [five couple]1927-five couple . It can be allowable only as the thought of the moment . ”[3299-somebody] [Somebody]3299-somebody said that [Miss Gilbert]230-miss gilbert was expected at [[her]230-miss gilbert brother]3179-her brother ’s , and must be invited with [the rest]1995-the rest . [Somebody else]1926-somebody else believed [Mrs. Gilbert]111-mrs. martin would have danced the other evening , if [she]111-mrs. martin had been asked . A word was put in for [a second young Cox]1997-a second young cox ; and at last , [Mr. Weston]82-mr. weston naming [one family of [cousins who must be included]1999-cousins who must be included]1998-one family of cousins who must be included , and [another of very old acquaintance who could not be left out]2000-another of very old acquaintance who could not be left out , it became a certainty that [the five couple]2001-the five couple would be at least ten , and a very interesting speculation in what possible manner [they]2001-the five couple could be disposed of . The doors of [the two rooms]2002-the two rooms were just opposite [each other]420-each other . “ Might not [they]2001-the five couple use [both rooms]4384-both rooms , and dance across [the passage]3927-the passage ? ”[79-emma] It seemed the best scheme ; and yet it was not so good but that many of [them]2001-the five couple wanted a better . [Emma]79-emma said it would be awkward ; [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston was in distress about the supper ; and [Mr. Woodhouse]81-mr. woodhouse opposed it earnestly , on the score of health . It made [him]81-mr. woodhouse so very unhappy , indeed , that it could not be persevered in . “ Oh ! no , ”[81-mr. woodhouse] said [he]81-mr. woodhouse ; “ it would be the extreme of imprudence . [I]81-mr. woodhouse could not bear it for [Emma!—Emma]231-emma!—emma is not strong . [She]231-emma!—emma would catch a dreadful cold . So would poor little [Harriet]107-harriet . So [you]4386-you would all . [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston , [you]84-mrs. weston would be quite laid up ; do not let [them]2001-the five couple talk of such a wild thing . Pray do not let [them]2001-the five couple talk of it . [That young man]4387-that young man ( speaking lower ) is very thoughtless . Do not tell [[his]4387-that young man father]3213-his father , but [that young man]4387-that young man is not quite the thing . [He]4387-that young man has been opening the doors very often this evening , and keeping them open very inconsiderately . [He]4387-that young man does not think of the draught . [I]81-mr. woodhouse do not mean to set [you]84-mrs. weston against [him]4387-that young man , but indeed [he]4387-that young man is not quite the thing ! ”[81-mr. woodhouse] [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston was sorry for such a charge . [She]84-mrs. weston knew the importance of it , and said every thing in [her]84-mrs. weston power to do it away . Every door was now closed , the passage plan given up , and the first scheme of dancing only in [the room [they]2005-we were in resorted to]2004-the room they were in resorted to again ; and with such good - will on [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill ’s part , that the space which a quarter of an hour before had been deemed barely sufficient for [five couple]1927-five couple , was now endeavoured to be made out quite enough for ten . “ [We]2005-we were too magnificent , ”[98-frank churchill] said [he]98-frank churchill . “ [We]2005-we allowed [unnecessary room]4390-unnecessary room . [Ten couple]4391-ten couple may stand here very well . ”[98-frank churchill] [Emma]79-emma demurred . “ It would be [a crowd]4392-a crowd — [a sad crowd]4393-a sad crowd ; and what could be worse than dancing without space to turn in ? ”[98-frank churchill] “ Very true , ”[98-frank churchill] [he]98-frank churchill gravely replied ; “ it was very bad . ”[98-frank churchill] But still [he]98-frank churchill went on measuring , and still [he]98-frank churchill ended with , “ [I]98-frank churchill think there will be very tolerable room for [ten couple]4391-ten couple . ”[98-frank churchill] “ No , no , ”[79-emma] said [she]79-emma , “ [you]98-frank churchill are quite unreasonable . It would be dreadful to be standing so close ! Nothing can be farther from pleasure than to be dancing in [a crowd]4392-a crowd — and a crowd in [a little room]4396-a little room ! ”[79-emma] “ There is no denying it , ”[98-frank churchill] [he]98-frank churchill replied . “ [I]98-frank churchill agree with [you]79-emma exactly . A crowd in [a little room]4396-a little room — [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield , [you]79-emma have the art of giving pictures in a few words . Exquisite , quite exquisite!—Still , however , having proceeded so far , [one]475-one is unwilling to give the matter up . It would be a disappointment to [[my]98-frank churchill father]3146-my father — and altogether — [I]98-frank churchill do not know that — [I]98-frank churchill am rather of opinion that [ten couple]4391-ten couple might stand [here]3113-here very well . ”[98-frank churchill] [Emma]79-emma perceived that the nature of [his]98-frank churchill gallantry was a little self - willed , and that [he]98-frank churchill would rather oppose than lose the pleasure of dancing with [her]79-emma ; but [she]79-emma took the compliment , and forgave the rest . Had [she]79-emma intended ever to marry [him]98-frank churchill , it might have been worth while to pause and consider , and try to understand the value of [his]98-frank churchill preference , and the character of [his]98-frank churchill temper ; but for all the purposes of [their]2007-their acquaintance , [he]98-frank churchill was quite amiable enough . Before the middle of the next day , [he]98-frank churchill was at [Hartfield]90-hartfield ; and [he]98-frank churchill entered [the room]3386-the room with such an agreeable smile as certified the continuance of the scheme . It soon appeared that [he]98-frank churchill came to announce an improvement . “ Well , [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield , ”[98-frank churchill] [he]98-frank churchill almost immediately began , “ [your]90-hartfield inclination for dancing has not been quite frightened away , [I]98-frank churchill hope , by the terrors of [[[my]98-frank churchill father]3146-my father ’s little rooms]4403-my father ’s little rooms . [I]98-frank churchill bring a new proposal on the subject:—a thought of [[my]98-frank churchill father]3146-my father ’s , which waits only [your]90-hartfield approbation to be acted upon . May [I]98-frank churchill hope for the honour of [your]90-hartfield hand for the two first dances of this little projected ball , to be given , not at [Randalls]97-randalls , but at [the Crown Inn]1734-the crown inn ? ”[98-frank churchill] “ The Crown ! ”[98-frank churchill] “ Yes ; if [you]90-hartfield and [Mr. Woodhouse]81-mr. woodhouse see no objection , and [I]98-frank churchill trust [you]90-hartfield can not , [[my]98-frank churchill father]3146-my father hopes [[his]3146-my father friends]3166-his friends will be so kind as to visit [him]3146-my father [there]437-there . Better accommodations , [he]3146-my father can promise [them]3166-his friends , and not a less grateful welcome than at [Randalls]97-randalls . It is [his]3146-my father own idea . [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston sees no objection to it , provided [you]90-hartfield are satisfied . This is what [we]4409-we all feel . Oh ! [you]90-hartfield were perfectly right ! [Ten couple]4391-ten couple , in either of [the Randalls rooms]4411-the randalls rooms , would have been insufferable!—Dreadful!—I felt how right [you]90-hartfield were the whole time , but was too anxious for securing any thing to like to yield . Is not it a good exchange?—You consent — [I]98-frank churchill hope [you]90-hartfield consent ? ”[98-frank churchill] “ It appears to [me]2009-i a plan that [nobody]3124-nobody can object to , if [Mr.]4413-mr. and [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston do not . [I]2009-i think it admirable ; and , as far as [I]2009-i can answer for [myself]2009-i , shall be most happy — It seems the only improvement that could be . [Papa]143-papa , do [you]143-papa not think it an excellent improvement ? ”[2009-i] [She]2009-i was obliged to repeat and explain it , before it was fully comprehended ; and then , being quite new , farther representations were necessary to make it acceptable . “ No ; [he]3146-my father thought it very far from an improvement — a very bad plan — much worse than the other . [A room at [an inn]4415-an inn]4414-a room at an inn was always damp and dangerous ; never properly aired , or fit to be inhabited . If [they]4391-ten couple must dance , [they]4391-ten couple had better dance at [Randalls]97-randalls . [He]3146-my father had never been in [the room at [the Crown]46-the crown in [his]3146-my father life]4416-the room at the crown in his life — did not know [the people who kept it by sight.—Oh]4417-the people who kept it by sight.—oh ! no — a very bad plan . [They]4391-ten couple would catch worse colds at the Crown than anywhere . ”[98-frank churchill] “ [I]98-frank churchill was going to observe , [sir]3139-sir , ”[98-frank churchill] said [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill , “ that one of the great recommendations of this change would be the very little danger of any body ’s catching cold — so much less danger at the Crown than at [Randalls]97-randalls ! [Mr. Perry]102-mr. perry might have reason to regret the alteration , but [nobody else]1495-nobody else could . ”[98-frank churchill] “ [Sir]3139-sir , ”[81-mr. woodhouse] said [Mr. Woodhouse]81-mr. woodhouse , rather warmly , “ [you]3139-sir are very much mistaken if [you]3139-sir suppose [Mr. Perry]102-mr. perry to be that sort of character . [Mr. Perry]102-mr. perry is extremely concerned when any of [us]4421-us are ill . But [I]81-mr. woodhouse do not understand how [the room at [the Crown]46-the crown]4422-the room at the crown can be safer for [you]3139-sir than [[[your]3139-sir father]1389-your father ’s house]4424-your father ’s house . ”[81-mr. woodhouse] “ From the very circumstance of [its]4422-the room at the crown being larger , [sir]3139-sir . [We]4421-us shall have no occasion to open the windows at all — not once the whole evening ; and it is that dreadful habit of opening the windows , letting in cold air upon heated bodies , which ( as [you]3139-sir well know , [sir]3139-sir ) does the mischief . ”[98-frank churchill] “ Open the windows!—but surely , [Mr. Churchill]98-frank churchill , [nobody]3124-nobody would think of opening the windows at [Randalls]97-randalls . [Nobody]3124-nobody could be so imprudent ! [I]98-frank churchill never heard of such a thing . Dancing with open windows!—I am sure , neither [[your]3139-sir father]1389-your father nor [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston ( poor [Miss Taylor]80-miss taylor that was ) would suffer it . ”[98-frank churchill] “ Ah ! [sir]3139-sir — but [a thoughtless young person]4431-a thoughtless young person will sometimes step behind a window - curtain , and throw up a sash , without its being suspected . [I]81-mr. woodhouse have often known it done [myself]81-mr. woodhouse . ”[81-mr. woodhouse] “ Have [you]3139-sir indeed , sir?—Bless [me]81-mr. woodhouse ! However , this does make a difference ; and , perhaps , when [we]4433-we come to talk it over — but these sort of things require a good deal of consideration . [One]475-one can not resolve upon [them]4435-them in a hurry . If [I]98-frank churchill could be sure of [the rooms]4443-the rooms being thoroughly aired — but is [Mrs. Stokes]232-mrs. stokes to be trusted ? [I]98-frank churchill doubt it . Do not [you]3139-sir remember what [Mr. Perry]102-mr. perry said , so many years ago , when [I]98-frank churchill had the measles ? ‘ If [Miss Taylor]80-miss taylor undertakes to wrap [Miss Emma]79-emma up , [you]3139-sir need not have any fears , [sir]3139-sir . ’ How often have [I]98-frank churchill heard [you]102-mr. perry speak of it as such a compliment to [her]79-emma ! ”[98-frank churchill] “ Aye , very true . [Mr. Perry]102-mr. perry did say so . [I]98-frank churchill shall never forget it . [Poor little Emma]79-emma ! [You]79-emma were very bad with the measles ; that is , [you]79-emma would have been very bad , but for [Perry]102-mr. perry ’s great attention . [He]102-mr. perry came four times a day for a week . [He]102-mr. perry said , from the first , it was a very good sort — which was [our]4446-our great comfort ; but the measles are a dreadful complaint . [I]98-frank churchill hope whenever [poor [Isabella]83-isabella ’s little ones]4447-poor isabella ’s little ones have the measles , [she]83-isabella will send for [Perry]102-mr. perry . ”[98-frank churchill] “ [[My]98-frank churchill father]3146-my father and [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston are at the Crown at this moment , ”[98-frank churchill] said [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill , “ examining the capabilities of [the house]425-the house . [I]98-frank churchill left [them]4447-poor isabella ’s little ones [there]437-there and came on to [Hartfield]90-hartfield , impatient for [your]79-emma opinion , and hoping [you]79-emma might be persuaded to join [them]4447-poor isabella ’s little ones and give [your]79-emma advice on the spot . [I]98-frank churchill was desired to say so from both .
