It was through a series of strange blunders ! ”[88-mr. knightley] “ And , in return for [your]79-emma acknowledging so much , [I]79-emma will do [you]79-emma the justice to say , that [you]79-emma would have chosen for [him]91-mr. elton better than [he]91-mr. elton has chosen for himself.—Harriet [Smith]107-harriet has some first - rate qualities , which [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton is totally without . [An unpretending , single - minded , artless girl]5028-an unpretending , single - minded , artless girl — infinitely to be preferred by [any man of sense and taste]5029-any man of sense and taste to [such a woman as [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton]5030-such a woman as mrs. elton . [I]79-emma found [Harriet]107-harriet more conversable than [I]79-emma expected . ”[79-emma] [Emma]79-emma was extremely gratified.—They were interrupted by the bustle of [Mr. Weston]82-mr. weston calling on [every body]3270-every body to begin dancing again . “ Come [Miss Woodhouse]80-miss taylor , [Miss Otway]292-miss otway , [Miss Fairfax]142-miss fairfax , what are [you]5031-you all doing?—Come [Emma]79-emma , set [[your]5031-you companions]5032-your companions the example . [Every body]3270-every body is lazy ! Every body is asleep ! ”[82-mr. weston] “ [I]79-emma am ready , ”[79-emma] said [Emma]79-emma , “ whenever [I]79-emma am wanted . ”[79-emma] “ Whom are [you]79-emma going to dance with ? ”[88-mr. knightley] asked [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley . [She]79-emma hesitated a moment , and then replied , “ With [you]88-mr. knightley , if [you]88-mr. knightley will ask [me]79-emma . ”[79-emma] “ Will [you]79-emma ? ”[88-mr. knightley] said [he]88-mr. knightley , offering [his]88-mr. knightley hand . “ Indeed [I]88-mr. knightley will . [You]79-emma have shewn that [you]79-emma can dance , and [you]79-emma know [we]5034-we are not really so much [brother and sister]5035-brother and sister as to make it at all improper . ”[88-mr. knightley] “ [Brother]768-brother and [sister]977-sister ! no , indeed . ”[79-emma] CHAPTER III This little explanation with [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley gave [Emma]79-emma considerable pleasure . It was one of the agreeable recollections of the ball , which [she]79-emma walked about [the lawn]4546-the lawn the next morning to enjoy.—She was extremely glad that [they]2355-they had come to so good an understanding respecting [the Eltons]134-the eltons , and that [their]2355-they opinions of both [husband]2356-husband and [wife]1845-wife were so much alike ; and [his]88-mr. knightley praise of [Harriet]107-harriet , [his]88-mr. knightley concession in [her]79-emma favour , was peculiarly gratifying . The impertinence of [the Eltons]134-the eltons , which for a few minutes had threatened to ruin the rest of [her]79-emma evening , had been the occasion of some of its highest satisfactions ; and [she]79-emma looked forward to another happy result — the cure of [Harriet]107-harriet ’s infatuation.—From [Harriet]107-harriet ’s manner of speaking of the circumstance before [they]2355-they quitted [the ballroom]2018-the ballroom , [she]107-harriet had strong hopes . It seemed as if [her]107-harriet eyes were suddenly opened , and [she]107-harriet were enabled to see that [Mr. Elton]91-mr. elton was not [the superior creature [she]107-harriet had believed [him]91-mr. elton]2359-the superior creature she had believed him . The fever was over , and [Emma]79-emma could harbour little fear of the pulse being quickened again by injurious courtesy . [She]107-harriet depended on the evil feelings of [the Eltons]134-the eltons for supplying all the discipline of pointed neglect that could be farther requisite.—Harriet rational , [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill not too much in love , and [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley not wanting to quarrel with [her]107-harriet , how very happy a summer must be before [her]107-harriet ! [She]79-emma was not to see [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill this morning . [He]98-frank churchill had told [her]79-emma that [he]98-frank churchill could not allow [himself]98-frank churchill the pleasure of stopping at [Hartfield]90-hartfield , as [he]98-frank churchill was to be at [home]3258-home by the middle of the day . [She]79-emma did not regret it . Having arranged all these matters , looked [them]2361-them through , and put [them]2361-them all to rights , [she]79-emma was just turning to [the house]425-the house with spirits freshened up for the demands of [the two little boys]2363-the two little boys , as well as of [[their]2363-the two little boys grandpapa]2179-their grandpapa , when the great iron sweep - gate opened , and [two persons entered whom [she]79-emma had never less expected to see together]2365-two persons entered whom she had never less expected to see together — [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill , with [Harriet]107-harriet leaning on [his]98-frank churchill arm — actually [Harriet!—A]301-harriet!—a moment sufficed to convince [her]79-emma that something extraordinary had happened . [Harriet]107-harriet looked white and frightened , and [he]98-frank churchill was trying to cheer her.—The iron gates and the front - door were not twenty yards asunder;—they were all three soon in [the hall]1685-the hall , and [Harriet]107-harriet immediately sinking into a chair fainted away . [A young lady who faints ,]2367-a young lady who faints , must be recovered ; questions must be answered , and surprizes be explained . Such events are very interesting , but the suspense of them can not last long . A few minutes made [Emma]79-emma acquainted with [the whole]2368-the whole . [Miss Smith]107-harriet , and [Miss Bickerton]302-miss bickerton , [another parlour boarder at [Mrs. Goddard]105-mrs. goddard ’s , who had been also at the ball]2369-another parlour boarder at mrs. goddard ’s , who had been also at the ball , had walked out together , and taken [a road]2370-a road , [the Richmond road]2371-the richmond road , which , though apparently public enough for safety , had led [them]2372-them into alarm.—About half a mile beyond [Highbury]3-highbury , making a sudden turn , and deeply shaded by elms on each side , it became for a considerable stretch very retired ; and when [the young ladies]3476-the young ladies had advanced some way into [it]2374-it , [they]3476-the young ladies had suddenly perceived at a small distance before [them]3476-the young ladies , on [a broader patch of greensward by the side]2375-a broader patch of greensward by the side , [a party of [gipsies]2377-gipsies]2376-a party of gipsies . [A child on the watch]2378-a child on the watch , came towards [them]2372-them to beg ; and [Miss Bickerton]302-miss bickerton , excessively frightened , gave a great scream , and calling on [Harriet]107-harriet to follow [her]302-miss bickerton , ran up [a steep bank]2379-a steep bank , cleared a slight hedge at the top , and made the best of [her]302-miss bickerton way by a short cut back to [Highbury]3-highbury . But poor [Harriet]107-harriet could not follow . [She]107-harriet had suffered very much from cramp after dancing , and [her]107-harriet first attempt to mount the bank brought on such a return of it as made [her]107-harriet absolutely powerless — and in this state , and exceedingly terrified , [she]107-harriet had been obliged to remain . How [the trampers]2380-the trampers might have behaved , had [the young ladies]3476-the young ladies been more courageous , must be doubtful ; but such an invitation for attack could not be resisted ; and [Harriet]107-harriet was soon assailed by [half a dozen children]2382-half a dozen children , headed by [a stout woman]2383-a stout woman and [a great boy , all clamorous , and impertinent in look , though not absolutely in word.—More and more frightened]2384-a great boy , all clamorous , and impertinent in look , though not absolutely in word.—more and more frightened , [she]107-harriet immediately promised [them]2382-half a dozen children money , and taking out [her]107-harriet purse , gave [them]2382-half a dozen children a shilling , and begged [them]2382-half a dozen children not to want more , or to use [her]107-harriet ill.—She was then able to walk , though but slowly , and was moving away — but [her]107-harriet terror and [her]107-harriet purse were too tempting , and [she]107-harriet was followed , or rather surrounded , by [the whole gang]2385-the whole gang , demanding more . In this state [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill had found [her]107-harriet , [she]107-harriet trembling and conditioning , [they]2382-half a dozen children loud and insolent . By a most fortunate chance [his]98-frank churchill leaving [Highbury]3-highbury had been delayed so as to bring [him]98-frank churchill to [her]107-harriet assistance at this critical moment . The pleasantness of the morning had induced [him]98-frank churchill to walk forward , and leave [his]98-frank churchill horses to meet [him]98-frank churchill by [another road]2386-another road , a mile or two beyond [Highbury]3-highbury — and happening to have borrowed a pair of scissors the night before of [Miss Bates]101-miss bates , and to have forgotten to restore them , [he]98-frank churchill had been obliged to stop at [her]107-harriet door , and go in for a few minutes : [he]98-frank churchill was therefore later than [he]98-frank churchill had intended ; and being on foot , was unseen by [the whole party]3782-the whole party till almost close to [them]3782-the whole party . The terror which [the woman]2102-the woman and [boy]1464-boy had been creating in [Harriet]107-harriet was then [their]3782-the whole party own portion . [He]98-frank churchill had left [them]3782-the whole party completely frightened ; and [Harriet]107-harriet eagerly clinging to [him]98-frank churchill , and hardly able to speak , had just strength enough to reach [Hartfield]90-hartfield , before [her]107-harriet spirits were quite overcome . It was [his]98-frank churchill idea to bring [her]107-harriet to [Hartfield]90-hartfield : [he]98-frank churchill had thought of no other place . This was the amount of the whole story,—of [his]98-frank churchill communication and of [Harriet]107-harriet ’s as soon as [she]107-harriet had recovered [her]107-harriet senses and speech.—He dared not stay longer than to see [her]107-harriet well ; these several delays left [him]98-frank churchill not another minute to lose ; and [Emma]79-emma engaging to give assurance of [her]107-harriet safety to [Mrs. Goddard]105-mrs. goddard , and notice of there being [such a set of people in [the neighbourhood]1737-the neighbourhood]2390-such a set of people in the neighbourhood to [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley , [he]98-frank churchill set off , with all the grateful blessings that [she]79-emma could utter for [[her]79-emma friend]417-her friend and [herself]79-emma . Such an adventure as [this,—a fine young man]2393-this,—a fine young man and [a lovely young woman]2394-a lovely young woman thrown together in such a way , could hardly fail of suggesting certain ideas to the coldest heart and the steadiest brain . So [Emma]79-emma thought , at least . Could [a linguist]2395-a linguist , could [a grammarian]2396-a grammarian , could even [a mathematician]2397-a mathematician have seen what [she]79-emma did , have witnessed [their]2398-their appearance together , and heard [their]2398-their history of it , without feeling that circumstances had been at work to make them peculiarly interesting to [each other?—How]2399-each other?—how much more must [an imaginist]2400-an imaginist , like [herself]79-emma , be on fire with speculation and foresight!—especially with such a groundwork of anticipation as [her]79-emma mind had already made . It was a very extraordinary thing ! Nothing of the sort had ever occurred before to [any young ladies in [the place]439-the place]2401-any young ladies in the place , within [her]79-emma memory ; no rencontre , no alarm of the kind;—and now it had happened to [the very person]2403-the very person , and at the very hour , when [the other very person]2404-the other very person was chancing to pass by to rescue her!—It certainly was very extraordinary!—And knowing , as [she]79-emma did , the favourable state of mind of each at this period , it struck [her]79-emma the more . [He]2393-this,—a fine young man was wishing to get the better of [his]2393-this,—a fine young man attachment to [herself]79-emma , [she]79-emma just recovering from [her]79-emma mania for [Mr. Elton]91-mr. elton . It seemed as if every thing united to promise the most interesting consequences . It was not possible that the occurrence should not be strongly recommending each to [the other]3423-the other . In the few minutes ’ conversation which [she]79-emma had yet had with [him]2393-this,—a fine young man , while [Harriet]107-harriet had been partially insensible , [he]2393-this,—a fine young man had spoken of [her]107-harriet terror , [her]107-harriet naïveté , [her]107-harriet fervour as [she]107-harriet seized and clung to [his]2393-this,—a fine young man arm , with a sensibility amused and delighted ; and just at last , after [Harriet]107-harriet ’s own account had been given , [he]2393-this,—a fine young man had expressed [his]2393-this,—a fine young man indignation at the abominable folly of [Miss Bickerton]302-miss bickerton in the warmest terms . Every thing was to take its natural course , however , neither impelled nor assisted . [She]79-emma would not stir a step , nor drop a hint . No , [she]79-emma had had enough of interference . There could be no harm in a scheme , a mere passive scheme . It was no more than a wish . Beyond it [she]79-emma would on no account proceed . [Emma]79-emma ’s first resolution was to keep [[her]79-emma father]415-her father from the knowledge of what had passed,—aware of the anxiety and alarm it would occasion : but [she]79-emma soon felt that concealment must be impossible . Within half an hour it was known all over [Highbury]3-highbury . It was the very event to engage [those who talk most]2407-those who talk most , [the young and the low]2408-the young and the low ; and [all [the youth]2410-the youth and servants in [the place]439-the place]2409-all the youth and servants in the place were soon in the happiness of frightful news . The last night ’s ball seemed lost in the gipsies . [Poor Mr. Woodhouse]81-mr. woodhouse trembled as [he]81-mr. woodhouse sat , and , as [Emma]79-emma had foreseen , would scarcely be satisfied without [their]2412-their promising never to go beyond the shrubbery again . It was some comfort to [him]2393-this,—a fine young man that many inquiries after [himself]2393-this,—a fine young man and [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield ( for [[his]2393-this,—a fine young man neighbours]3235-his neighbours knew that [he]2393-this,—a fine young man loved to be inquired after ) , as well as [Miss Smith]107-harriet , were coming in during the rest of the day ; and [he]2393-this,—a fine young man had the pleasure of returning for answer , that [they]2412-their were all very indifferent — which , though not exactly true , for [she]79-emma was perfectly well , and [Harriet]107-harriet not much otherwise , [Emma]79-emma would not interfere with . [She]79-emma had an unhappy state of health in general for [the child of such a man]2414-the child of such a man , for [she]79-emma hardly knew what indisposition was ; and if [he]2393-this,—a fine young man did not invent illnesses for [her]79-emma , [she]79-emma could make no figure in a message . [The gipsies]2415-the gipsies did not wait for the operations of justice ; [they]2415-the gipsies took [themselves]2415-the gipsies off in a hurry . [The young ladies of [Highbury]3-highbury]2416-the young ladies of highbury might have walked again in safety before [their]2416-the young ladies of highbury panic began , and the whole history dwindled soon into a matter of little importance but to [Emma]79-emma and [her]79-emma nephews:—in [her]79-emma imagination it maintained its ground , and [Henry]118-henry and [John]88-mr. knightley were still asking every day for the story of [Harriet]107-harriet and [the gipsies]2415-the gipsies , and still tenaciously setting [her]107-harriet right if [she]107-harriet varied in the slightest particular from the original recital . CHAPTER IV A very few days had passed after this adventure , when [Harriet]107-harriet came one morning to [Emma]79-emma with a small parcel in [her]107-harriet hand , and after sitting down and hesitating , thus began : “ [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield — if [you]79-emma are at leisure — [I]107-harriet have something that [I]107-harriet should like to tell [you]79-emma — a sort of confession to make — and then , [you]79-emma know , it will be over . ”[107-harriet] [Emma]79-emma was a good deal surprized ; but begged [her]107-harriet to speak . There was a seriousness in [Harriet]107-harriet ’s manner which prepared [her]79-emma , quite as much as [her]107-harriet words , for something more than ordinary . “ It is [my]107-harriet duty , and [I]107-harriet am sure it is [my]107-harriet wish , ”[107-harriet] [she]107-harriet continued , “ to have no reserves with [you]79-emma on this subject . As [I]107-harriet am happily quite [an altered creature]5038-an altered creature in one respect , it is very fit that [you]79-emma should have the satisfaction of knowing it . [I]107-harriet do not want to say more than is necessary — [I]107-harriet am too much ashamed of having given way as [I]107-harriet have done , and [I]107-harriet dare say [you]79-emma understand [me]107-harriet . ”[107-harriet] “ Yes , ”[79-emma] said [Emma]79-emma , “ [I]79-emma hope [I]79-emma do . ”[79-emma] “ How [I]107-harriet could so long a time be fancying [myself]107-harriet ! ... ”[107-harriet] cried [Harriet]107-harriet , warmly . “ It seems like madness ! [I]2418-i can see nothing at all extraordinary in [him]5039-him now.—I do not care whether [I]2418-i meet [him]5039-him or not — except that of the two [I]2418-i had rather not see [him]5039-him — and indeed [I]2418-i would go any distance round to avoid [him]5039-him — but [I]2418-i do not envy [[his]5039-him wife]3168-his wife in the least ; [I]2418-i neither admire [her]3168-his wife nor envy [her]3168-his wife , as [I]2418-i have done : [she]3168-his wife is very charming , [I]2418-i dare say , and all that , but [I]2418-i think [her]3168-his wife very ill - tempered and disagreeable — [I]2418-i shall never forget [her]3168-his wife look the other night!—However , [I]2418-i assure [you]5041-you , [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield , [I]2418-i wish [her]3168-his wife no evil.—No , let [them]5042-them be ever so happy together , it will not give [me]2418-i another moment ’s pang : and to convince [you]5041-you that [I]2418-i have been speaking truth , [I]2418-i am now going to destroy — what [I]2418-i ought to have destroyed long ago — what [I]2418-i ought never to have kept — [I]2418-i know that very well ( blushing as [she]3168-his wife spoke).—However , now [I]2418-i will destroy it all — and it is [my]2418-i particular wish to do it in [your]5041-you presence , that [you]5041-you may see how rational [I]2418-i am grown . Can not [you]5041-you guess what this parcel holds ? ”[2418-i] said [she]2418-i , with a conscious look . “ Not the least in the world.—Did [he]5043-he ever give [you]5041-you any thing ? ”[2418-i] “ No — [I]2418-i can not call them gifts ; but they are things that [I]2418-i have valued very much . ”[2418-i] [She]2418-i held the parcel towards [her]2418-i , and [Emma]79-emma read the words Most precious treasures on the top . [Her]79-emma curiosity was greatly excited . [Harriet]107-harriet unfolded the parcel , and [she]107-harriet looked on with impatience . Within abundance of silver paper was a pretty little Tunbridge - ware box , which [Harriet]107-harriet opened : it was well lined with the softest cotton ; but , excepting the cotton , [Emma]79-emma saw only a small piece of court - plaister . “ Now , ”[107-harriet] said [Harriet]107-harriet , “ [you]79-emma must recollect . ”[107-harriet] “ No , indeed [I]107-harriet do not . ”[107-harriet] “ Dear [me]107-harriet ! [I]107-harriet should not have thought it possible [you]5041-you could forget what passed in [this very room]5044-this very room about [court - plaister]5045-court - plaister , one of the very last times [we]5046-we ever met in it!—It was but a very few days before [I]107-harriet had [my]107-harriet sore throat — just before [Mr.]5047-mr. and [Mrs. John Knightley]117-mrs. john knightley came — [I]107-harriet think the very evening.—Do not [you]5041-you remember [his]5047-mr. cutting [his]5047-mr. finger with [your]5041-you new penknife , and [your]5041-you recommending court - plaister?—But , as [you]5041-you had none about [you]5041-you , and knew [I]107-harriet had , [you]5041-you desired [me]107-harriet to supply [him]5047-mr. ; and so [I]107-harriet took [mine]107-harriet out and cut [him]5047-mr. a piece ; but it was a great deal too large , and [he]5047-mr. cut it smaller , and kept playing some time with what was left , before [he]5047-mr. gave it back to [me]107-harriet . And so then , in [my]107-harriet nonsense , [I]107-harriet could not help making a treasure of it — so [I]107-harriet put it by never to be used , and looked at it now and then as a great treat . ”[107-harriet] “ [[My]79-emma dearest]696-my dearest [Harriet]107-harriet ! ”[79-emma] cried [Emma]79-emma , putting [her]79-emma hand before [her]79-emma face , and jumping up , “ [you]107-harriet make [me]79-emma more ashamed of [myself]79-emma than [I]79-emma can bear . Remember it ? Aye , [I]79-emma remember it all now ; all , except [your]107-harriet saving this relic — [I]79-emma knew nothing of that till this moment — but the cutting the finger , and [my]79-emma recommending court - plaister , and saying [I]79-emma had none about me!—Oh ! [my]79-emma sins , [my]79-emma sins!—And [I]79-emma had plenty all the while in [my]79-emma pocket!—One of [my]79-emma senseless tricks!—I deserve to be under a continual blush all the rest of [my]79-emma life.—Well—(sitting down again)—go on — what else ? ”[79-emma] “ And had [you]107-harriet really some at hand [yourself]107-harriet ? [I]79-emma am sure [I]79-emma never suspected it , [you]107-harriet did it so naturally . ”[79-emma] “ And so [you]107-harriet actually put this piece of court - plaister by for [his]5049-his sake ! ”[79-emma] said [Emma]79-emma , recovering from [her]79-emma state of shame and feeling divided between wonder and amusement . And secretly [she]79-emma added to [herself]79-emma , “ [Lord]5050-lord bless [me]79-emma ! when should [I]79-emma ever have thought of putting by in cotton a piece of court - plaister that [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill had been pulling about ! [I]79-emma never was equal to this . ”[79-emma] “ Here , ”[107-harriet] resumed [Harriet]107-harriet , turning to [her]107-harriet box again , “ here is something still more valuable , [I]107-harriet mean that has been more valuable , because this is what did really once belong to [him]5049-his , which [the court - plaister]5051-the court - plaister never did . ”[107-harriet] [Emma]79-emma was quite eager to see this superior treasure . It was the end of an old pencil,—the part without any lead . “ This was really [his]5049-his , ”[79-emma] said [Harriet.—“Do]303-harriet.—“do not [you]107-harriet remember one morning?—no , [I]79-emma dare say [you]107-harriet do not . But one morning — [I]79-emma forget exactly the day — but perhaps it was the Tuesday or Wednesday before that evening , [he]5049-his wanted to make a memorandum in [his]5049-his pocket - book ; it was about spruce - beer . [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley had been telling [him]5049-his something about brewing spruce - beer , and [he]5049-his wanted to put it down ; but when [he]5049-his took out [his]5049-his pencil , there was so little lead that [he]5049-his soon cut it all away , and it would not do , so [you]107-harriet lent [him]5049-his another , and this was left upon the table as good for nothing . But [I]79-emma kept [my]79-emma eye on it ; and , as soon as [I]79-emma dared , caught it up , and never parted with it again from that moment . ”[79-emma] “ [I]79-emma do remember it , ”[79-emma] cried [Emma]79-emma ; “ [I]79-emma perfectly remember it.—Talking about spruce - beer.—Oh ! yes — [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley and [I]79-emma both saying [we]5052-we liked it , and [Mr. Elton]91-mr. elton ’s seeming resolved to learn to like it too . [I]79-emma perfectly remember it.—Stop ; [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley was standing just here , was not [he]91-mr. elton ? [I]79-emma have an idea [he]91-mr. elton was standing just here . ”[79-emma] “ Ah ! [I]79-emma do not know . [I]79-emma can not recollect.—It is very odd , but [I]79-emma can not recollect.—Mr . [Elton]91-mr. elton was sitting here , [I]79-emma remember , much about where [I]79-emma am now . ”[79-emma] — “ Well , go on . ”[79-emma] “ Oh ! that ’s all . [I]79-emma have nothing more to shew [you]79-emma , or to say — except that [I]79-emma am now going to throw [them]5053-them both behind the fire , and [I]79-emma wish [you]79-emma to see [me]79-emma do it . ”[79-emma] “ [My]79-emma poor dear [Harriet]107-harriet ! and have [you]79-emma actually found happiness in treasuring up these things ? ”[79-emma] “ Yes , [simpleton]5054-simpleton as [I]79-emma was!—but [I]79-emma am quite ashamed of it now , and wish [I]79-emma could forget as easily as [I]79-emma can burn them . It was very wrong of [me]79-emma , [you]79-emma know , to keep any remembrances , after [he]5054-simpleton was married . [I]79-emma knew it was — but had not resolution enough to part with [them]5053-them . ”[79-emma] “ But , [Harriet]107-harriet , is it necessary to burn [the court - plaister?—I]5055-the court - plaister?—i have not a word to say for the bit of old pencil , but [the court - plaister]5051-the court - plaister might be useful . ”[79-emma] “ [I]107-harriet shall be happier to burn it , ”[107-harriet] replied [Harriet]107-harriet . “ It has a disagreeable look to [me]107-harriet . [I]107-harriet must get rid of every thing.—There it goes , and there is an end , thank [Heaven]165-good heaven ! of [Mr. Elton]91-mr. elton . ”[107-harriet] “ And when , ”[79-emma] thought [Emma]79-emma , “ will there be a beginning of [Mr. Churchill]98-frank churchill ? ”[79-emma] [She]79-emma had soon afterwards reason to believe that the beginning was already made , and could not but hope that [the gipsy]2419-the gipsy , though [she]2419-the gipsy had told no fortune , might be proved to have made [Harriet’s.—About]304-harriet’s.—about a fortnight after the alarm , [they]2420-they came to a sufficient explanation , and quite undesignedly . [Emma]79-emma was not thinking of it at the moment , which made the information [she]79-emma received more valuable . [She]79-emma merely said , in the course of some trivial chat , “ Well , [Harriet]107-harriet , whenever [you]107-harriet marry [I]79-emma would advise [you]107-harriet to do so and so”—and[79-emma] thought no more of it , till after a minute ’s silence [she]79-emma heard [Harriet]107-harriet say in a very serious tone , “ [I]107-harriet shall never marry . ”[107-harriet] [Emma]79-emma then looked up , and immediately saw how it was ; and after a moment ’s debate , as to whether it should pass unnoticed or not , replied , “ Never marry!—This is a new resolution . ”[107-harriet] “ It is one that [I]79-emma shall never change , however . ”[79-emma] After another short hesitation , “ [I]79-emma hope it does not proceed from — [I]79-emma hope it is not in compliment to [Mr. Elton]91-mr. elton ? ”[79-emma] “ [Mr. Elton]91-mr. elton indeed ! ”[107-harriet] cried [Harriet]107-harriet indignantly.—“Oh ! [no”—and[107-harriet] Emma]79-emma could just catch the words , “ so superior to [Mr. Elton]91-mr. elton ! ”[107-harriet] [She]79-emma then took a longer time for consideration . Should [she]107-harriet proceed no farther?—should [she]107-harriet let it pass , and seem to suspect nothing?—Perhaps [Harriet]107-harriet might think [her]107-harriet cold or angry if [she]107-harriet did ; or perhaps if [she]107-harriet were totally silent , it might only drive [Harriet]107-harriet into asking [her]107-harriet to hear too much ; and against any thing like such an unreserve as had been , such an open and frequent discussion of hopes and chances , [she]107-harriet was perfectly resolved.—She believed it would be wiser for [her]107-harriet to say and know at once , all that [she]107-harriet meant to say and know . Plain dealing was always best . [She]107-harriet had previously determined how far [she]107-harriet would proceed , on any application of the sort ; and it would be safer for both , to have the judicious law of [her]107-harriet own brain laid down with speed.—She was decided , and thus spoke — “ [Harriet]107-harriet , [I]107-harriet will not affect to be in doubt of [your]107-harriet meaning . [Your]107-harriet resolution , or rather [your]107-harriet expectation of never marrying , results from an idea that [the person whom [you]107-harriet might prefer]5057-the person whom you might prefer , would be too greatly [your]107-harriet superior in situation to think of [you]107-harriet . Is not it so ? ”[107-harriet] “ Oh ! [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield , believe [me]107-harriet [I]107-harriet have not the presumption to suppose — Indeed [I]107-harriet am not so mad.—But it is a pleasure to [me]107-harriet to admire [him]5057-the person whom you might prefer at a distance — and to think of [his]5057-the person whom you might prefer infinite superiority to all the rest of [the world]392-the world , with the gratitude , wonder , and veneration , which are so proper , in [me]107-harriet especially . ”[107-harriet] “ [I]107-harriet am not at all surprized at [you]107-harriet , [Harriet]107-harriet . The service [he]5057-the person whom you might prefer rendered [you]107-harriet was enough to warm [your]107-harriet heart . ”[107-harriet] “ Service ! oh ! it was such an inexpressible obligation!—The very recollection of it , and all that [I]107-harriet felt at the time — when [I]107-harriet saw [him]5057-the person whom you might prefer coming — [his]5057-the person whom you might prefer noble look — and [my]107-harriet wretchedness before . Such a change ! In one moment such a change ! From perfect misery to perfect happiness ! ”[107-harriet] “ It is very natural . It is natural , and it is honourable.—Yes , honourable , [I]107-harriet think , to chuse so well and so gratefully.—But that it will be a fortunate preference is more than [I]107-harriet can promise . [I]107-harriet do not advise [you]107-harriet to give way to it , [Harriet]107-harriet . [I]107-harriet do not by any means engage for its being returned . Consider what [you]107-harriet are about . Perhaps it will be wisest in [you]107-harriet to check [your]107-harriet feelings while [you]107-harriet can : at any rate do not let [them]5059-them carry [you]107-harriet far , unless [you]107-harriet are persuaded of [his]5057-the person whom you might prefer liking [you]107-harriet . Be observant of [him]5057-the person whom you might prefer . Let [his]5057-the person whom you might prefer behaviour be the guide of [your]107-harriet sensations . [I]107-harriet give [you]107-harriet this caution now , because [I]107-harriet shall never speak to [you]107-harriet again on the subject . [I]107-harriet am determined against all interference . Henceforward [I]107-harriet know nothing of the matter . Let no name ever pass [our]5060-we lips . [We]5060-we were very wrong before ; [we]5060-we will be cautious now.—He is [your]107-harriet superior , no doubt , and there do seem objections and obstacles of a very serious nature ; but yet , [Harriet]107-harriet , more wonderful things have taken place , there have been matches of greater disparity . But take care of [yourself]107-harriet . [I]107-harriet would not have [you]107-harriet too sanguine ; though , however it may end , be assured [your]107-harriet raising [your]107-harriet thoughts to [him]417-her friend , is a mark of good taste which [I]107-harriet shall always know how to value . ”[107-harriet] [Harriet]107-harriet kissed [her]107-harriet hand in silent and submissive gratitude . [Emma]79-emma was very decided in thinking such an attachment no bad thing for [[her]79-emma friend]417-her friend . Its tendency would be to raise and refine [her]79-emma mind — and it must be saving [her]79-emma from the danger of degradation . CHAPTER V In this state of schemes , and hopes , and connivance , [June]266-june opened upon [Hartfield]90-hartfield . To [Highbury]3-highbury in general it brought no material change . [The Eltons]134-the eltons were still talking of a visit from [the Sucklings]305-the sucklings , and of the use to be made of [[their]305-the sucklings barouche - landau]4562-their barouche - landau ; and [Jane Fairfax]142-miss fairfax was still at [[her]142-miss fairfax grandmother]1062-her grandmother ’s ; and as the return of [the Campbells]180-the campbells from [Ireland]34-ireland was again delayed , and [August]306-august , instead of Midsummer , fixed for it , [she]142-miss fairfax was likely to remain there full two months longer , provided at least [she]142-miss fairfax were able to defeat [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton ’s activity in [her]142-miss fairfax service , and save [herself]142-miss fairfax from being hurried into a delightful situation against [her]142-miss fairfax will . [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley , who , for some reason best known to [himself]88-mr. knightley , had certainly taken an early dislike to [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill , was only growing to dislike [him]88-mr. knightley more . [He]88-mr. knightley began to suspect [him]88-mr. knightley of some double dealing in [his]88-mr. knightley pursuit of [Emma]79-emma . That [Emma]79-emma was [his]88-mr. knightley object appeared indisputable . Every thing declared it ; [his]88-mr. knightley own attentions , [[his]88-mr. knightley father]3213-his father ’s hints , [[his]88-mr. knightley mother - in - law]1704-his mother - in - law ’s guarded silence ; it was all in unison ; words , conduct , discretion , and indiscretion , told the same story . But while so many were devoting [him]88-mr. knightley to [Emma]79-emma , and [Emma]79-emma [herself]79-emma making [him]88-mr. knightley over to [Harriet]107-harriet , [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley began to suspect [him]88-mr. knightley of some inclination to trifle with [Jane Fairfax]142-miss fairfax . [He]88-mr. knightley could not understand it ; but there were symptoms of intelligence between [them]2426-them — [he]88-mr. knightley thought so at least — symptoms of admiration on [his]88-mr. knightley side , which , having once observed , [he]88-mr. knightley could not persuade [himself]88-mr. knightley to think entirely void of meaning , however [he]88-mr. knightley might wish to escape any of [Emma]79-emma ’s errors of imagination . [She]142-miss fairfax was not present when the suspicion first arose . [He]88-mr. knightley was dining with [the Randalls family]2427-the randalls family , and [Jane]142-miss fairfax , at [the Eltons]134-the eltons ’ ; and [he]88-mr. knightley had seen a look , more than a single look , at [Miss Fairfax]142-miss fairfax , which , from [the admirer of [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield]2428-the admirer of miss woodhouse , seemed somewhat out of place . When [he]88-mr. knightley was again in [their]2426-them company , [he]88-mr. knightley could not help remembering what [he]88-mr. knightley had seen ; nor could [he]88-mr. knightley avoid observations which , unless it were like [Cowper]307-cowper and [his]88-mr. knightley fire at twilight , “ [Myself]88-mr. knightley creating what [I]88-mr. knightley saw , ”[88-mr. knightley] brought [him]88-mr. knightley yet stronger suspicion of there being a something of private liking , of private understanding even , between [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill and [Jane]142-miss fairfax . [He]88-mr. knightley had walked up one day after dinner , as [he]88-mr. knightley very often did , to spend [his]88-mr. knightley evening at [Hartfield]90-hartfield . [Emma]79-emma and [Harriet]107-harriet were going to walk ; [he]88-mr. knightley joined [them]2426-them ; and , on returning , [they]2426-them fell in with [a larger party]2429-a larger party , who , like [themselves]2426-them , judged it wisest to take [their]2426-them exercise early , as the weather threatened rain ; [Mr.]2430-mr. and [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston and [[their]2431-their son]2432-their son , [Miss Bates]101-miss bates and [[her]101-miss bates niece]3833-her niece , who had accidentally met . [They]2426-them all united ; and , on reaching [Hartfield]90-hartfield gates , [[Emma]79-emma , who knew it was exactly the sort of visiting that would be welcome to [[her]79-emma father]415-her father]2434-emma , who knew it was exactly the sort of visiting that would be welcome to her father , pressed [them]2426-them all to go in and drink tea with [him]88-mr. knightley . [The Randalls party]2436-the randalls party agreed to it immediately ; and after a pretty long speech from [Miss Bates]101-miss bates , which [few persons listened to]2437-few persons listened to , [she]101-miss bates also found it possible to accept dear [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield ’s most obliging invitation . As [they]2426-them were turning into [the grounds]4545-the grounds , [Mr. Perry]102-mr. perry passed by on horseback . [The gentlemen]1743-the gentlemen spoke of [his]102-mr. perry horse . “ By the bye , ”[98-frank churchill] said [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill to [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston presently , “ what became of [Mr. Perry]102-mr. perry ’s plan of setting up [[his]102-mr. perry carriage]3651-his carriage ? ”[84-mrs. weston] [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston looked surprized , and said , “ [I]84-mrs. weston did not know that [he]102-mr. perry ever had any such plan . ”[84-mrs. weston] “ Nay , [I]84-mrs. weston had it from [you]84-mrs. weston . [You]84-mrs. weston wrote [me]84-mrs. weston word of it three months ago . ”[84-mrs. weston] “ [Me]84-mrs. weston ! impossible ! ”[84-mrs. weston] “ Indeed [you]84-mrs. weston did . [I]84-mrs. weston remember it perfectly . [You]84-mrs. weston mentioned it as what was certainly to be very soon . [Mrs. Perry]100-mrs. perry had told [somebody]3299-somebody , and was extremely happy about it . It was owing to [her]100-mrs. perry persuasion , as [she]100-mrs. perry thought [his]102-mr. perry being out in bad weather did [him]102-mr. perry a great deal of harm . [You]84-mrs. weston must remember it now ? ”[84-mrs. weston] “ Upon [my]84-mrs. weston word [I]84-mrs. weston never heard of it till this moment . ”[84-mrs. weston] “ Never ! really , never!—Bless [me]84-mrs. weston ! how could it be?—Then [I]84-mrs. weston must have dreamt it — but [I]84-mrs. weston was completely persuaded — [Miss Smith]107-harriet , [you]107-harriet walk as if [you]107-harriet were tired . [You]107-harriet will not be sorry to find [yourself]107-harriet at [home]3258-home . ”[84-mrs. weston] “ What is this?—What is this ? ”[82-mr. weston] cried [Mr. Weston]82-mr. weston , “ about [Perry]102-mr. perry and [a carriage]2294-a carriage ? [You]98-frank churchill had it from [himself]102-mr. perry , had [you]98-frank churchill ? ”[82-mr. weston] “ No , [sir]3139-sir , ”[3218-his son] replied [[his]82-mr. weston son]3218-his son , laughing , “ [I]3218-his son seem to have had it from nobody.—Very odd!—I really was persuaded of [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston ’s having mentioned it in one of [her]84-mrs. weston letters to [Enscombe]7-enscombe , many weeks ago , with all these particulars — but as [she]84-mrs. weston declares [she]84-mrs. weston never heard a syllable of it before , of course it must have been a dream . [I]3218-his son am [a great dreamer]5067-a great dreamer . [I]3218-his son dream of every body at [Highbury]3-highbury when [I]3218-his son am away — and when [I]3218-his son have gone through [[my]3218-his son particular friends]5068-my particular friends , then [I]3218-his son begin dreaming of [Mr.]5069-mr. and [Mrs. Perry]100-mrs. perry . ”[3218-his son] “ It is odd though , ”[3213-his father] observed [[his]3218-his son father]3213-his father , “ that [you]3218-his son should have had such a regular connected dream about people whom it was not very likely [you]3218-his son should be thinking of at [Enscombe]7-enscombe . [Perry]100-mrs. perry ’s setting up [[his]3213-his father carriage]3651-his carriage ! and [[his]3213-his father wife]3168-his wife ’s persuading [him]3213-his father to it , out of care for [his]3213-his father health — just what will happen , [I]3213-his father have no doubt , some time or other ; only a little premature . What an air of probability sometimes runs through a dream ! And at others , what a heap of absurdities it is ! Well , [Frank]98-frank churchill , [your]98-frank churchill dream certainly shews that [Highbury]3-highbury is in [your]98-frank churchill thoughts when [you]98-frank churchill are absent . [Emma]79-emma , [you]79-emma are [a great dreamer]5067-a great dreamer , [I]3213-his father think ? ”[3213-his father] [Emma]79-emma was out of hearing . [She]79-emma had hurried on before [[her]79-emma guests]2442-her guests to prepare [[her]79-emma father]415-her father for [their]2442-her guests appearance , and was beyond the reach of [Mr. Weston]82-mr. weston ’s hint . “ Why , to own the truth , ”[101-miss bates] cried [Miss Bates]101-miss bates , who had been trying in vain to be heard the last two minutes , “ if [I]101-miss bates must speak on this subject , there is no denying that [Mr. Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill might have — [I]101-miss bates do not mean to say that [he]98-frank churchill did not dream it — [I]101-miss bates am sure [I]101-miss bates have sometimes the oddest dreams in [the world]392-the world — but if [I]101-miss bates am questioned about it , [I]101-miss bates must acknowledge that there was such an idea last spring ; for [Mrs. Perry]100-mrs. perry [herself]100-mrs. perry mentioned it to [[my]101-miss bates mother]1513-my mother , and [the Coles]175-the coles knew of it as well as [ourselves]5075-us — but it was quite a secret , known to [nobody else]1495-nobody else , and only thought of about three days . [Mrs. Perry]100-mrs. perry was very anxious that [he]98-frank churchill should have [a carriage]2294-a carriage , and came to [[my]101-miss bates mother]1513-my mother in great spirits one morning because [she]1513-my mother thought [she]1513-my mother had prevailed . [Jane]101-miss bates , do n’t [you]101-miss bates remember [grandmama]298-grandmama ’s telling [us]5075-us of it when [we]5075-us got [home]3258-home ? [I]101-miss bates forget where [we]5075-us had been walking to — very likely to [Randalls]97-randalls ; yes , [I]101-miss bates think it was to [Randalls]97-randalls . [Mrs. Perry]100-mrs. perry was always particularly fond of [[my]101-miss bates mother]1513-my mother — indeed [I]101-miss bates do not know who is not — and [she]100-mrs. perry had mentioned it to [her]100-mrs. perry in confidence ; [she]100-mrs. perry had no objection to [her]100-mrs. perry telling [us]5075-us , of course , but it was not to go beyond : and , from that day to this , [I]101-miss bates never mentioned it to [a soul that [I]101-miss bates know of]5081-a soul that i know of . At the same time , [I]101-miss bates will not positively answer for [my]101-miss bates having never dropt a hint , because [I]101-miss bates know [I]101-miss bates do sometimes pop out a thing before [I]101-miss bates am aware . [I]101-miss bates am [a talker]5082-a talker , [you]5083-you know ; [I]101-miss bates am rather [a talker]5082-a talker ; and now and then [I]101-miss bates have let a thing escape [me]101-miss bates which [I]101-miss bates should not . [I]101-miss bates am not like [Jane]101-miss bates ; [I]101-miss bates wish [I]101-miss bates were . [I]101-miss bates will answer for it [she]101-miss bates never betrayed the least thing in [the world]392-the world . Where is she?—Oh ! just behind . Perfectly remember [Mrs. Perry]100-mrs. perry ’s coming.—Extraordinary dream , indeed ! ”[101-miss bates] [They]2444-they were entering [the hall]1685-the hall . [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley ’s eyes had preceded [Miss Bates]101-miss bates ’s in a glance at [Jane]101-miss bates . From [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill ’s face , where [he]98-frank churchill thought [he]98-frank churchill saw confusion suppressed or laughed away , [he]98-frank churchill had involuntarily turned to [hers]101-miss bates ; but [she]101-miss bates was indeed behind , and too busy with [her]101-miss bates shawl . [Mr. Weston]82-mr. weston had walked in . [The two other gentlemen]2446-the two other gentlemen waited at the door to let [her]101-miss bates pass . [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley suspected in [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill the determination of catching [her]101-miss bates eye — [he]98-frank churchill seemed watching [her]101-miss bates intently — in vain , however , if it were so — [Jane]101-miss bates passed between [them]2446-the two other gentlemen into [the hall]1685-the hall , and looked at neither . There was no time for farther remark or explanation . The dream must be borne with , and [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley must take [his]88-mr. knightley seat with the rest round the large modern circular table which [Emma]79-emma had introduced at [Hartfield]90-hartfield , and which none but [Emma]79-emma could have had power to place there and persuade [[her]79-emma father]415-her father to use , instead of the small - sized Pembroke , on which two of [his]88-mr. knightley daily meals had , for forty years been crowded . [Tea]276-tea passed pleasantly , and [nobody]3124-nobody seemed in a hurry to move . “ [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield , ”[98-frank churchill] said [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill , after examining a table behind [him]98-frank churchill , which [he]98-frank churchill could reach as [he]98-frank churchill sat , “ have [[your]90-hartfield nephews]5086-your nephews taken away [their]5086-your nephews alphabets — [their]5086-your nephews box of letters ? It used to stand [here]3113-here . Where is it ? This is a sort of dull - looking evening , that ought to be treated rather as winter than summer . [We]5088-we had great amusement with those letters one morning . [I]98-frank churchill want to puzzle [you]90-hartfield again . ”[98-frank churchill] [Emma]79-emma was pleased with the thought ; and producing the box , the table was quickly scattered over with alphabets , which [no one]813-no one seemed so much disposed to employ as [[their]2451-them two selves]2452-their two selves . [They]2451-them were rapidly forming words for [each other]420-each other , or for [any body else who would be puzzled]2454-any body else who would be puzzled . The quietness of the game made it particularly eligible for [Mr. Woodhouse]81-mr. woodhouse , who had often been distressed by the more animated sort , which [Mr. Weston]82-mr. weston had occasionally introduced , and who now sat happily occupied in lamenting , with tender melancholy , over the departure of [the “ poor little boys]5089-the “ poor little boys , ”[98-frank churchill] or in fondly pointing out , as [he]98-frank churchill took up any stray letter near [him]98-frank churchill , how beautifully [Emma]79-emma had written it . [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill placed a word before [Miss Fairfax]142-miss fairfax . [She]142-miss fairfax gave a slight glance round the table , and applied [herself]142-miss fairfax to it . [Frank]98-frank churchill was next to [Emma]79-emma , [Jane]142-miss fairfax opposite to [them]2451-them — and [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley so placed as to see [them]2451-them all ; and it was [his]98-frank churchill object to see as much as [he]98-frank churchill could , with as little apparent observation . The word was discovered , and with a faint smile pushed away . If meant to be immediately mixed with the others , and buried from sight , [she]142-miss fairfax should have looked on the table instead of looking just across , for it was not mixed ; and [Harriet]107-harriet , eager after every fresh word , and finding out none , directly took it up , and fell to work . [She]107-harriet was sitting by [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley , and turned to [him]88-mr. knightley for help . The word was blunder ; and as [Harriet]107-harriet exultingly proclaimed it , there was a blush on [Jane]142-miss fairfax ’s cheek which gave it a meaning not otherwise ostensible . [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley connected it with the dream ; but how it could all be , was beyond [his]88-mr. knightley comprehension . How the delicacy , the discretion of [[his]98-frank churchill favourite]2455-his favourite could have been so lain asleep ! [He]98-frank churchill feared there must be some decided involvement . Disingenuousness and double dealing seemed to meet [him]98-frank churchill at every turn . These letters were but the vehicle for gallantry and trick . It was [a child]603-a child ’s play , chosen to conceal a deeper game on [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill ’s part . With great indignation did [he]98-frank churchill continue to observe [him]98-frank churchill ; with great alarm and distrust , to observe also [[his]98-frank churchill two blinded companions]2457-his two blinded companions . [He]98-frank churchill saw a short word prepared for [Emma]79-emma , and given to [her]79-emma with a look sly and demure . [He]98-frank churchill saw that [Emma]79-emma had soon made it out , and found it highly entertaining , though it was something which [she]79-emma judged it proper to appear to censure ; for [she]79-emma said , “ Nonsense ! for shame ! ”[79-emma] [He]98-frank churchill heard [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill next say , with a glance towards [Jane]142-miss fairfax , “ [I]98-frank churchill will give it to [her]79-emma — shall [I?”—and]98-frank churchill[98-frank churchill] as clearly heard [Emma]79-emma opposing it with eager laughing warmth . “ No , no , [you]142-miss fairfax must not ; [you]142-miss fairfax shall not , indeed . ”[79-emma] It was done however . [This gallant young man , who seemed to love without feeling , and to recommend [himself]2458-this gallant young man , who seemed to love without feeling , and to recommend himself without complaisance without complaisance]2458-this gallant young man , who seemed to love without feeling , and to recommend himself without complaisance , directly handed over the word to [Miss Fairfax]142-miss fairfax , and with a particular degree of sedate civility entreated [her]142-miss fairfax to study it . [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley ’s excessive curiosity to know what this word might be , made [him]88-mr. knightley seize every possible moment for darting [his]88-mr. knightley eye towards it , and it was not long before [he]88-mr. knightley saw it to be [Dixon]182-mr. dixon . [Jane Fairfax]142-miss fairfax ’s perception seemed to accompany [his]88-mr. knightley ; [her]142-miss fairfax comprehension was certainly more equal to the covert meaning , the superior intelligence , of those five letters so arranged . [She]142-miss fairfax was evidently displeased ; looked up , and seeing [herself]142-miss fairfax watched , blushed more deeply than [he]88-mr. knightley had ever perceived [her]142-miss fairfax , and saying only , “ [I]88-mr. knightley did not know that proper names were allowed , ”[88-mr. knightley] pushed away the letters with even an angry spirit , and looked resolved to be engaged by no other word that could be offered . [Her]142-miss fairfax face was averted from [those who had made the attack]2459-those who had made the attack , and turned towards [[her]142-miss fairfax aunt]1061-her aunt . “ Aye , very true , [[my]1955-the latter dear]3120-my dear , ”[1955-the latter] cried [the latter]1955-the latter , though [Jane]142-miss fairfax had not spoken a word—“I was just going to say the same thing . It is time for [us]5091-us to be going indeed . The evening is closing in , and [grandmama]1518-grandmama will be looking for [us]5091-us . [[My]1955-the latter dear sir]741-my dear sir , [you]741-my dear sir are too obliging . [We]5091-us really must wish [you]741-my dear sir good night . ”[1955-the latter] [Jane]142-miss fairfax ’s alertness in moving , proved [her]142-miss fairfax as ready as [[her]142-miss fairfax aunt]1061-her aunt had preconceived . [She]142-miss fairfax was immediately up , and wanting to quit the table ; but so many were also moving , that [she]142-miss fairfax could not get away ; and [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley thought [he]88-mr. knightley saw another collection of letters anxiously pushed towards [her]142-miss fairfax , and resolutely swept away by [her]142-miss fairfax unexamined . [She]142-miss fairfax was afterwards looking for [her]142-miss fairfax shawl — [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill was looking also — it was growing dusk , and [the room]3386-the room was in confusion ; and how [they]2464-they parted , [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley could not tell . [He]88-mr. knightley remained at [Hartfield]90-hartfield after all the rest , [his]88-mr. knightley thoughts full of what [he]88-mr. knightley had seen ; so full , that when the candles came to assist [his]88-mr. knightley observations , [he]88-mr. knightley must — yes , [he]88-mr. knightley certainly must , as [a friend]405-a friend — [an anxious friend]2466-an anxious friend — give [Emma]79-emma some hint , ask [her]79-emma some question . [He]88-mr. knightley could not see [her]79-emma in a situation of such danger , without trying to preserve [her]79-emma . It was [his]88-mr. knightley duty . “ Pray , [Emma]79-emma , ”[88-mr. knightley] said [he]88-mr. knightley , “ may [I]88-mr. knightley ask in what lay the great amusement , the poignant sting of the last word given to [you]79-emma and [Miss Fairfax]142-miss fairfax ? [I]88-mr. knightley saw the word , and am curious to know how it could be so very entertaining to [the one]5094-the one , and so very distressing to the other . ”[88-mr. knightley] [Emma]79-emma was extremely confused . [She]79-emma could not endure to give [him]88-mr. knightley the true explanation ; for though [her]79-emma suspicions were by no means removed , [she]79-emma was really ashamed of having ever imparted them . “ Oh ! ”[79-emma] [she]79-emma cried in evident embarrassment , “ it all meant nothing ; a mere joke among [ourselves]5095-ourselves . ”[79-emma] “ The joke , ”[88-mr. knightley] [he]88-mr. knightley replied gravely , “ seemed confined to [you]79-emma and [Mr. Churchill]98-frank churchill . ”[88-mr. knightley] [He]88-mr. knightley had hoped [she]79-emma would speak again , but [she]79-emma did not . [She]79-emma would rather busy [herself]79-emma about any thing than speak . [He]88-mr. knightley sat a little while in doubt . A variety of evils crossed [his]88-mr. knightley mind . Interference — fruitless interference . [Emma]79-emma ’s confusion , and the acknowledged intimacy , seemed to declare [her]79-emma affection engaged . Yet [he]88-mr. knightley would speak . [He]88-mr. knightley owed it to [her]79-emma , to risk any thing that might be involved in an unwelcome interference , rather than [her]79-emma welfare ; to encounter any thing , rather than the remembrance of neglect in such a cause . “ [[My]88-mr. knightley dear]3120-my dear [Emma]79-emma , ”[88-mr. knightley] said [he]88-mr. knightley at last , with earnest kindness , “ do [you]79-emma think [you]79-emma perfectly understand the degree of acquaintance between [the gentleman]3371-the gentleman and [lady]5098-lady [we]5099-we have been speaking of ? ”[88-mr. knightley] “ Between [Mr. Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill and [Miss Fairfax]142-miss fairfax ? Oh ! yes , perfectly.—Why do [you]88-mr. knightley make a doubt of it ? ”[2467-i] “ Have [you]88-mr. knightley never at any time had reason to think that [he]88-mr. knightley admired [her]79-emma , or that [she]79-emma admired [him]88-mr. knightley ? ”[2467-i] “ Never , never ! ”[79-emma] [she]79-emma cried with a most open eagerness—“Never , for the twentieth part of a moment , did such an idea occur to [me]2467-i . And how could it possibly come into [your]88-mr. knightley head ? ”[2467-i] “ [I]2467-i have lately imagined that [I]2467-i saw symptoms of attachment between [them]5100-them — certain expressive looks , which [I]2467-i did not believe meant to be public . ”[2467-i] “ Oh ! [you]79-emma amuse [me]2467-i excessively . [I]2467-i am delighted to find that [you]79-emma can vouchsafe to let [your]79-emma imagination wander — but it will not do — very sorry to check [you]79-emma in [your]79-emma first essay — but indeed it will not do . There is no admiration between [them]5100-them , [I]2467-i do assure [you]79-emma ; and the appearances which have caught [you]79-emma , have arisen from some peculiar circumstances — feelings rather of a totally different nature — it is impossible exactly to explain:—there is a good deal of nonsense in it — but the part which is capable of being communicated , which is sense , is , that [they]5100-them are as far from any attachment or admiration for one another , as [any two beings in [the world]392-the world]5101-any two beings in the world can be . That is , [I]2467-i presume it to be so on [her]2467-i side , and [I]2467-i can answer for its being so on [his]88-mr. knightley . [I]2467-i will answer for [the gentleman]3371-the gentleman ’s indifference . ”[2467-i] [She]2467-i spoke with a confidence which staggered , with a satisfaction which silenced , [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley . [She]2467-i was in gay spirits , and would have prolonged the conversation , wanting to hear the particulars of [his]88-mr. knightley suspicions , every look described , and all the where s and how s of a circumstance which highly entertained [her]2467-i : but [his]88-mr. knightley gaiety did not meet [hers]2467-i . [He]88-mr. knightley found [he]88-mr. knightley could not be useful , and [his]88-mr. knightley feelings were too much irritated for talking . That [he]88-mr. knightley might not be irritated into an absolute fever , by the fire which [Mr. Woodhouse]81-mr. woodhouse ’s tender habits required almost every evening throughout the year , [he]88-mr. knightley soon afterwards took a hasty leave , and walked [home]3258-home to the coolness and solitude of [Donwell Abbey]202-donwell . CHAPTER VI After being long fed with hopes of a speedy visit from [Mr.]2469-mr. and [Mrs. Suckling]308-mrs. suckling , the [Highbury]3-highbury world were obliged to endure the mortification of hearing that [they]2470-they could not possibly come till the autumn . No such importation of novelties could enrich [their]2470-they intellectual stores at present . In the daily interchange of news , [they]2470-they must be again restricted to the other topics with which for a while [the Sucklings]2471-the sucklings ’ coming had been united , such as the last accounts of [Mrs. Churchill]94-mrs. churchill , whose health seemed every day to supply a different report , and the situation of [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston , whose happiness it was to be hoped might eventually be as much increased by the arrival of [a child]603-a child , as that of all [[her]2467-i neighbours]2473-her neighbours was by the approach of it . [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton was very much disappointed . It was the delay of a great deal of pleasure and parade . [Her]195-mrs. elton introductions and recommendations must all wait , and [every projected party]2474-every projected party be still only talked of . So [she]195-mrs. elton thought at first;—but a little consideration convinced [her]195-mrs. elton that every thing need not be put off . Why should not [they]2470-they explore to [Box Hill]64-box hill though [the Sucklings]305-the sucklings did not come ? [They]2470-they could go [there]437-there again with [them]2470-they in the autumn . It was settled that [they]2470-they should go to [Box Hill]64-box hill . That there was to be such a party had been long generally known : it had even given the idea of another . [Emma]79-emma had never been to [Box Hill]64-box hill ; [she]79-emma wished to see what every body found so well worth seeing , and [she]79-emma and [Mr. Weston]82-mr. weston had agreed to chuse some fine morning and drive thither . [Two or three more of [the chosen only]2477-the chosen only]2476-two or three more of the chosen only were to be admitted to join [them]2470-they , and it was to be done in a quiet , unpretending , elegant way , infinitely superior to the bustle and preparation , the regular eating and drinking , and picnic parade of [the Eltons]134-the eltons and [the Sucklings]2471-the sucklings . This was so very well understood between [them]2470-they , that [Emma]79-emma could not but feel some surprise , and a little displeasure , on hearing from [Mr. Weston]82-mr. weston that [he]82-mr. weston had been proposing to [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton , as [[her]79-emma brother and sister]2479-her brother and sister had failed [her]79-emma , that [the two parties]2480-the two parties should unite , and go together ; and that as [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton had very readily acceded to it , so it was to be , if [she]195-mrs. elton had no objection . Now , as [her]195-mrs. elton objection was nothing but [her]195-mrs. elton very great dislike of [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton , of which [Mr. Weston]82-mr. weston must already be perfectly aware , it was not worth bringing forward again:—it could not be done without a reproof to [him]82-mr. weston , which would be giving pain to [[his]82-mr. weston wife]3168-his wife ; and [she]195-mrs. elton found [herself]195-mrs. elton therefore obliged to consent to an arrangement which [she]195-mrs. elton would have done a great deal to avoid ; an arrangement which would probably expose [her]195-mrs. elton even to the degradation of being said to be of [[Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton ’s party]2482-mrs. elton ’s party ! Every feeling was offended ; and the forbearance of [her]195-mrs. elton outward submission left a heavy arrear due of secret severity in [her]195-mrs. elton reflections on the unmanageable goodwill of [Mr. Weston]82-mr. weston ’s temper . “ [I]82-mr. weston am glad [you]195-mrs. elton approve of what [I]82-mr. weston have done , ”[82-mr. weston] said [he]82-mr. weston very comfortably . “ But [I]82-mr. weston thought [you]195-mrs. elton would . Such schemes as these are nothing without numbers . [One]475-one can not have too large a party . [A large party]5105-a large party secures [its]5105-a large party own amusement . And [she]195-mrs. elton is [a good - natured woman]5106-a good - natured woman after all . [One]475-one could not leave [her]195-mrs. elton out . ”[82-mr. weston] [Emma]79-emma denied none of it aloud , and agreed to none of it in private . It was now the middle of June , and the weather fine ; and [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton was growing impatient to name the day , and settle with [Mr. Weston]82-mr. weston as to pigeon - pies and cold lamb , when a lame carriage - horse threw every thing into sad uncertainty . It might be weeks , it might be only a few days , before the horse were useable ; but no preparations could be ventured on , and it was all melancholy stagnation . [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton ’s resources were inadequate to such an attack . “ Is not this most vexatious , [Knightley]88-mr. knightley ? ”[195-mrs. elton] [she]195-mrs. elton cried.—“And such weather for exploring!—These delays and disappointments are quite odious . What are [we]5108-we to do?—The year will wear away at this rate , and nothing done . Before this time last year [I]195-mrs. elton assure [you]88-mr. knightley [we]5108-we had had a delightful exploring party from [Maple Grove]53-maple grove to [Kings Weston]309-kings weston . ”[195-mrs. elton] “ [You]195-mrs. elton had better explore to [Donwell]202-donwell , ”[88-mr. knightley] replied [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley . “ That may be done without horses . Come , and eat [my]88-mr. knightley strawberries . They are ripening fast . ”[88-mr. knightley] If [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley did not begin seriously , [he]88-mr. knightley was obliged to proceed so , for [his]88-mr. knightley proposal was caught at with delight ; and the “ Oh ! [I]88-mr. knightley should like it of all things , ”[88-mr. knightley] was not plainer in words than manner . [Donwell]202-donwell was famous for [its]202-donwell strawberry - beds , which seemed a plea for the invitation : but no plea was necessary ; cabbage - beds would have been enough to tempt [the lady]774-the lady , who only wanted to be going somewhere . [She]195-mrs. elton promised [him]88-mr. knightley again and again to come — much oftener than [he]88-mr. knightley doubted — and was extremely gratified by such a proof of intimacy , such a distinguishing compliment as [she]195-mrs. elton chose to consider it . “ [You]88-mr. knightley may depend upon [me]195-mrs. elton , ”[195-mrs. elton] said [she]195-mrs. elton . “ [I]195-mrs. elton certainly will come . It is to be a morning scheme , [you]195-mrs. elton know , [Knightley]88-mr. knightley ; quite a simple thing . [I]195-mrs. elton shall wear a large bonnet , and bring one of [my]195-mrs. elton little baskets hanging on [my]195-mrs. elton arm . Here,—probably this basket with pink ribbon . [We]5123-we are to walk about [[your]195-mrs. elton gardens]5124-your gardens , and gather the strawberries [ourselves]5123-we , and sit under trees;—and whatever else [you]195-mrs. elton may like to provide , it is to be all out of doors — a table spread in the shade , [you]195-mrs. elton know . If [you]195-mrs. elton wish [me]195-mrs. elton to talk to [Mrs. Hodges]224-mrs. hodges , or to inspect anything — ”[195-mrs. elton] “ [I]195-mrs. elton have not the least wish for it , [I]195-mrs. elton thank [you]195-mrs. elton . ”[195-mrs. elton] “ Well — but if any difficulties should arise , [[my]195-mrs. elton housekeeper]4618-my housekeeper is extremely clever . ”[195-mrs. elton] “ [I]195-mrs. elton will answer for it , that [mine]195-mrs. elton thinks [herself]4618-my housekeeper full as clever , and would spurn [any body]530-any body ’s assistance . ”[195-mrs. elton] “ [I]195-mrs. elton wish [we]5123-we had a donkey . [You]195-mrs. elton can borrow [Mrs. Cole]176-mrs. cole ’s .
