As [I]195-mrs. elton tell [Mr. E.]245-mr. e. , [you]195-mrs. elton are [a thorough humourist.—Yes]5139-a thorough humourist.—yes , believe [me]195-mrs. elton , [Knightley]88-mr. knightley , [I]195-mrs. elton am fully sensible of [your]195-mrs. elton attention to [me]195-mrs. elton in the whole of this scheme . [You]195-mrs. elton have hit upon the very thing to please [me]195-mrs. elton . ”[195-mrs. elton] [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley had another reason for avoiding a table in the shade . [He]88-mr. knightley wished to persuade [Mr. Woodhouse]81-mr. woodhouse , as well as [Emma]79-emma , to join the party ; and [he]88-mr. knightley knew that to have any of [them]2485-them sitting down out of doors to eat would inevitably make [him]88-mr. knightley ill . [Mr. Woodhouse]81-mr. woodhouse must not , under the specious pretence of a morning drive , and an hour or two spent at [Donwell]202-donwell , be tempted away to [his]81-mr. woodhouse misery . [He]81-mr. woodhouse was invited on good faith . No lurking horrors were to upbraid [him]81-mr. woodhouse for [his]81-mr. woodhouse easy credulity . [He]81-mr. woodhouse did consent . [He]81-mr. woodhouse had not been at [Donwell]202-donwell for two years . “ Some very fine morning , [he]81-mr. woodhouse , and [Emma]79-emma , and [Harriet]107-harriet , could go very well ; and [he]81-mr. woodhouse could sit still with [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston , while [the dear girls]5140-the dear girls walked about [the gardens]5141-the gardens . [He]81-mr. woodhouse did not suppose [they]5141-the gardens could be damp now , in the middle of the day . [He]81-mr. woodhouse should like to see [the old house]5142-the old house again exceedingly , and should be very happy to meet [Mr.]5143-mr. and [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton , and [any other of [his]81-mr. woodhouse neighbours.—He]5144-any other of his neighbours.—he could not see any objection at all to [his]5143-mr. , and [Emma]79-emma ’s , and [Harriet]107-harriet ’s going [there]437-there some very fine morning . [He]81-mr. woodhouse thought it very well done of [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley to invite [them]2487-them — very kind and sensible — much cleverer than dining out.—He was not fond of dining out . ”[81-mr. woodhouse] [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley was fortunate in [every body]3270-every body ’s most ready concurrence . The invitation was everywhere so well received , that it seemed as if , like [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton , [they]2487-them were all taking the scheme as a particular compliment to themselves.—Emma and [Harriet]107-harriet professed very high expectations of pleasure from it ; and [Mr. Weston]82-mr. weston , unasked , promised to get [Frank]98-frank churchill over to join [them]2487-them , if possible ; a proof of approbation and gratitude which could have been dispensed with.—Mr . [Knightley]88-mr. knightley was then obliged to say that [he]88-mr. knightley should be glad to see [him]98-frank churchill ; and [Mr. Weston]82-mr. weston engaged to lose no time in writing , and spare no arguments to induce [him]98-frank churchill to come . In the meanwhile the lame horse recovered so fast , that [the party]3632-the party to [Box Hill]64-box hill was again under happy consideration ; and at last [Donwell]202-donwell was settled for one day , and [Box Hill]64-box hill for the next,—the weather appearing exactly right . Under a bright mid - day sun , at almost Midsummer , [Mr. Woodhouse]81-mr. woodhouse was safely conveyed in [[his]81-mr. woodhouse carriage]3651-his carriage , with one window down , to partake of this al - fresco party ; and in [one of the most comfortable rooms in [the Abbey]505-the abbey]2490-one of the most comfortable rooms in the abbey , especially prepared for [him]81-mr. woodhouse by a fire all the morning , [he]81-mr. woodhouse was happily placed , quite at [his]81-mr. woodhouse ease , ready to talk with pleasure of what had been achieved , and advise every body to come and sit down , and not to heat themselves.—Mrs . [Weston]82-mr. weston , who seemed to have walked [there]437-there on purpose to be tired , and sit all the time with [him]98-frank churchill , remained , when [all the others]2493-all the others were invited or persuaded out , [his]98-frank churchill patient listener and [sympathiser]2494-sympathiser . It was so long since [Emma]79-emma had been at [the Abbey]505-the abbey , that as soon as [she]79-emma was satisfied of [[her]79-emma father]415-her father ’s comfort , [she]79-emma was glad to leave [him]415-her father , and look around [her]79-emma ; eager to refresh and correct [her]79-emma memory with more particular observation , more exact understanding of [a house]2497-a house and grounds which must ever be so interesting to [her]79-emma and [all [her]79-emma family]2498-all her family . [She]79-emma felt all the honest pride and complacency which [her]79-emma alliance with [the present and future proprietor]2499-the present and future proprietor could fairly warrant , as [she]79-emma viewed the respectable size and style of [the building]2500-the building , [its]2500-the building suitable , becoming , characteristic situation , low and sheltered — [[its]2500-the building ample gardens]2501-its ample gardens stretching down to meadows washed by [a stream]2502-a stream , of which [the Abbey]505-the abbey , with all the old neglect of prospect , had scarcely a sight — and [its]2500-the building abundance of timber in rows and [avenues]2504-avenues , which neither fashion nor extravagance had rooted [up.—The house]2505-up.—the house was larger than [Hartfield]90-hartfield , and totally unlike [it]2505-up.—the house , covering a good deal of ground , rambling and irregular , with many comfortable , and one or two handsome rooms.—It was just what [it]2505-up.—the house ought to be , and [it]2505-up.—the house looked what [it]2505-up.—the house was — and [Emma]79-emma felt an increasing respect for [it]2505-up.—the house , as [the residence of [a family of such true gentility]2507-a family of such true gentility , untainted in blood and understanding.—Some faults of temper [John Knightley]88-mr. knightley had]2506-the residence of a family of such true gentility , untainted in blood and understanding.—some faults of temper john knightley had ; but [Isabella]83-isabella had connected [herself]83-isabella unexceptionably . [She]83-isabella had given [them]2507-a family of such true gentility neither [men]828-men , nor names , nor places , that could raise a blush . These were pleasant feelings , and [she]83-isabella walked about and indulged them till it was necessary to do as [the others]3512-the others did , and collect round [the strawberry - beds.—The whole party]2510-the strawberry - beds.—the whole party were assembled , excepting [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill , who was expected every moment from [Richmond]62-richmond ; and [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton , in all [her]195-mrs. elton apparatus of happiness , [her]195-mrs. elton large bonnet and [her]195-mrs. elton basket , was very ready to lead the way in gathering , accepting , or talking — strawberries , and only strawberries , could now be thought or spoken of.—“The best fruit in [England]38-england — [every body]3270-every body ’s favourite — always wholesome.—These the finest beds and finest sorts.—Delightful to gather for [one]475-one ’s self — the only way of really enjoying them.—Morning decidedly the best time — never tired — [every sort good — hautboy]5148-every sort good — hautboy infinitely superior — no comparison — [the others hardly eatable — hautboys very scarce — Chili preferred — white wood finest flavour of all]5149-the others hardly eatable — hautboys very scarce — chili preferred — white wood finest flavour of all — price of strawberries in [London]1-london — abundance about [Bristol]43-bristol — [Maple Grove]53-maple grove — cultivation — beds when to be renewed — [gardeners]5150-gardeners thinking exactly different — no general rule — [gardeners]5150-gardeners never to be put out of [their]5150-gardeners way — delicious fruit — only too rich to be eaten much of — inferior to cherries — currants more refreshing — only objection to gathering strawberries the stooping — glaring sun — tired to death — could bear it no longer — must go and sit in the shade . ”[84-mrs. weston] Such , for half an hour , was the conversation — interrupted only once by [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston , who came out , in [her]84-mrs. weston solicitude after [[her]84-mrs. weston son - in - law]1948-her son - in - law , to inquire if [he]1948-her son - in - law were come — and [she]84-mrs. weston was a little uneasy.—She had some fears of [his]1948-her son - in - law horse . Seats tolerably in the shade were found ; and now [Emma]79-emma was obliged to overhear what [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton and [Jane Fairfax]142-miss fairfax were talking of.—A situation , a most desirable situation , was in question . [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton had received notice of it that morning , and was in raptures . It was not with [Mrs. Suckling]308-mrs. suckling , it was not with [Mrs. Bragge]267-mrs. bragge , but in felicity and splendour it fell short only of [them]2512-them : it was with [a cousin of [Mrs. Bragge]267-mrs. bragge]2513-a cousin of mrs. bragge , [an acquaintance of [Mrs. Suckling]308-mrs. suckling]2514-an acquaintance of mrs. suckling , [a lady known at [Maple Grove]53-maple grove]2515-a lady known at maple grove . Delightful , charming , superior , first circles , spheres , lines , ranks , every thing — and [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton was wild to have the offer closed with immediately.—On [her]195-mrs. elton side , all was warmth , energy , and triumph — and [she]195-mrs. elton positively refused to take [[her]195-mrs. elton friend]417-her friend ’s negative , though [Miss Fairfax]142-miss fairfax continued to assure [her]195-mrs. elton that [she]195-mrs. elton would not at present engage in any thing , repeating the same motives which [she]195-mrs. elton had been heard to urge before.—Still [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton insisted on being authorised to write an acquiescence by [the morrow]2517-the morrow ’s post.—How [Jane]142-miss fairfax could bear it at all , was astonishing to [Emma.—She]312-emma.—she did look vexed , [she]312-emma.—she did speak pointedly — and at last , with a decision of action unusual to [her]312-emma.—she , proposed a removal.—“Should not [they]2520-they walk ? Would not [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley shew them [the gardens]5141-the gardens — [all the gardens?—She]5153-all the gardens?—she wished to see the whole extent . ”—The[312-emma.—she] pertinacity of [[her]195-mrs. elton friend]417-her friend seemed more than [she]195-mrs. elton could bear . It was hot ; and after walking some time over [the gardens]5141-the gardens in a scattered , dispersed way , scarcely any three together , [they]2520-they insensibly followed one another to the delicious shade of a broad short avenue of limes , which stretching beyond [the garden]5129-the garden at an equal distance from [the river]2522-the river , seemed the finish of the pleasure grounds.—It led to nothing ; nothing but a view at the end over a low stone wall with high pillars , which seemed intended , in their erection , to give the appearance of an approach to [the house]425-the house , which never had been [there]437-there . Disputable , however , as might be the taste of such a termination , [it]2525-it was in itself a charming walk , and the view which closed [it]2525-it extremely pretty.—The considerable slope , at nearly the foot of which [the Abbey]505-the abbey stood , gradually acquired a steeper form beyond [[its]505-the abbey grounds]2527-its grounds ; and at half a mile distant was a bank of considerable abruptness and grandeur , well clothed with wood;—and at the bottom of this bank , favourably placed and sheltered , rose [the Abbey Mill Farm]2528-the abbey mill farm , with [meadows in front]2529-meadows in front , and [the river]2522-the river making a close and handsome curve around [it]2528-the abbey mill farm . It was a sweet view — sweet to the eye and the mind . English verdure , English culture , English comfort , seen under a sun bright , without being oppressive . In this walk [Emma]79-emma and [Mr. Weston]82-mr. weston found [all the others assembled]2531-all the others assembled ; and towards this view [she]79-emma immediately perceived [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley and [Harriet]107-harriet distinct from [the rest]1995-the rest , quietly leading the way . [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley and [Harriet!—It]313-harriet!—it was an odd tête - à - tête ; but [she]79-emma was glad to see it.—There had been a time when [he]88-mr. knightley would have scorned [her]79-emma as [a companion]569-a companion , and turned from [her]79-emma with little ceremony . Now [they]2534-they seemed in pleasant conversation . There had been a time also when [Emma]79-emma would have been sorry to see [Harriet]107-harriet in [a spot so favourable for [the Abbey Mill Farm]2528-the abbey mill farm]2535-a spot so favourable for the abbey mill farm ; but now [she]79-emma feared it not . [It]2528-the abbey mill farm might be safely viewed with all [its]2528-the abbey mill farm appendages of prosperity and beauty , [its]2528-the abbey mill farm rich pastures , spreading flocks , orchard in blossom , and light column of smoke ascending.—She joined [them]2534-they at the wall , and found [them]2534-they more engaged in talking than in looking around . [He]88-mr. knightley was giving [Harriet]107-harriet information as to modes of agriculture , etc . and [Emma]79-emma received a smile which seemed to say , “ These are [my]88-mr. knightley own concerns . [I]88-mr. knightley have a right to talk on such subjects , without being suspected of introducing [Robert Martin]111-mrs. martin . ”—She[88-mr. knightley] did not suspect [him]88-mr. knightley . It was too old a story.—Robert [Martin]111-mrs. martin had probably ceased to think of [Harriet.—They]314-harriet.—they took a few turns together along the walk.—The shade was most refreshing , and [Emma]79-emma found it the pleasantest part of the day . The next remove was to [the house]425-the house ; [they]2534-they must all go in and eat;—and [they]2534-they were all seated and busy , and still [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill did not come . [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston looked , and looked in vain . [[His]88-mr. knightley father]3213-his father would not own [himself]3213-his father uneasy , and laughed at [her]84-mrs. weston fears ; but [she]84-mrs. weston could not be cured of wishing that [he]3213-his father would part with [his]3213-his father black mare . [He]3213-his father had expressed [himself]3213-his father as to coming , with more than common certainty . “ [[His]88-mr. knightley aunt]1331-his aunt was so much better , that [he]3213-his father had not a doubt of getting over to [them]1331-his aunt . ”—Mrs[3213-his father] . [Churchill]98-frank churchill ’s state , however , as many were ready to remind [her]84-mrs. weston , was liable to such sudden variation as might disappoint [[her]84-mrs. weston nephew]1441-her nephew in the most reasonable dependence — and [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston was at last persuaded to believe , or to say , that it must be by some attack of [Mrs. Churchill]94-mrs. churchill that [he]3213-his father was prevented coming.—Emma looked at [Harriet]107-harriet while the point was under consideration ; [she]107-harriet behaved very well , and betrayed no emotion . The cold repast was over , and [the party]3632-the party were to go out once more to see what had not yet been seen , [the old Abbey fish - ponds]2541-the old abbey fish - ponds ; perhaps get as far as the clover , which was to be begun cutting on the morrow , or , at any rate , have the pleasure of being hot , and growing cool again.—Mr . [Woodhouse]81-mr. woodhouse , who had already taken [his]81-mr. woodhouse little round in [the highest part of [the gardens]5141-the gardens]2542-the highest part of the gardens , where no damps from [the river]2522-the river were imagined even by [him]81-mr. woodhouse , stirred no more ; and [[his]81-mr. woodhouse daughter]3129-his daughter resolved to remain with [him]81-mr. woodhouse , that [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston might be persuaded away by [[her]84-mrs. weston husband]431-her husband to the exercise and variety which [her]84-mrs. weston spirits seemed to need . [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley had done all in [his]88-mr. knightley power for [Mr. Woodhouse]81-mr. woodhouse ’s entertainment . Books of engravings , drawers of medals , cameos , corals , shells , and every other family collection within [his]81-mr. woodhouse cabinets , had been prepared for [[his]81-mr. woodhouse old friend]2547-his old friend , to while away the morning ; and the kindness had perfectly answered . [Mr. Woodhouse]81-mr. woodhouse had been exceedingly well amused . [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston had been shewing them all to [him]81-mr. woodhouse , and now [he]81-mr. woodhouse would shew them all to Emma;—fortunate in having no other resemblance to [a child]603-a child , than in a total want of taste for what [he]81-mr. woodhouse saw , for [he]81-mr. woodhouse was slow , constant , and methodical.—Before this second looking over was begun , however , [Emma]79-emma walked into [the hall]1685-the hall for the sake of a few moments ’ free observation of the entrance and ground - plot of [the house]425-the house — and was hardly there , when [Jane Fairfax]142-miss fairfax appeared , coming quickly in from [the garden]5129-the garden , and with a look of escape.—Little expecting to meet [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield so soon , there was a start at first ; but [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield was [the very person [she]142-miss fairfax was in quest of]2552-the very person she was in quest of . “ Will [you]81-mr. woodhouse be so kind , ”[142-miss fairfax] said [she]142-miss fairfax , “ when [I]142-miss fairfax am missed , as to say that [I]142-miss fairfax am gone home?—I am going this moment.—My [aunt]1419-aunt is not aware how late it is , nor how long [we]5156-we have been absent — but [I]142-miss fairfax am sure [we]5156-we shall be wanted , and [I]142-miss fairfax am determined to go [directly.—I]142-miss fairfax have said nothing about it to [any body]530-any body . It would only be giving trouble and distress . [Some]2343-some are gone to [the ponds]5159-the ponds , and [some to the lime walk]5160-some to the lime walk . Till [they]5161-they all come in [I]142-miss fairfax shall not be missed ; and when [they]5161-they do , will [you]81-mr. woodhouse have the goodness to say that [I]142-miss fairfax am gone ? ”[142-miss fairfax] “ Certainly , if [you]81-mr. woodhouse wish it;—but [you]81-mr. woodhouse are not going to walk to [Highbury]3-highbury alone ? ”[2553-me] “ Yes — what should hurt me?—I walk fast . [I]142-miss fairfax shall be at [home]3258-home in twenty minutes . ”[142-miss fairfax] “ But it is too far , indeed it is , to be walking quite alone . It can be round in five minutes . ”[142-miss fairfax] “ Thank [you]81-mr. woodhouse , thank [you]81-mr. woodhouse — but on no account.—I would rather walk.—And for [me]2553-me to be afraid of walking alone!—I , who may so soon have to guard [others]473-others ! ”[2553-me] [She]2553-me spoke with great agitation ; and [Emma]79-emma very feelingly replied , “ That can be no reason for [your]81-mr. woodhouse being exposed to danger now . [I]79-emma must order [the carriage]3125-the carriage . The heat even would be danger.—You are fatigued already . ”[79-emma] “ [I]142-miss fairfax am,”—she[142-miss fairfax] [answered—“I]142-miss fairfax am fatigued ; but it is not the sort of fatigue — quick walking will refresh [me.—Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield , [we]5168-we all know at times what it is to be wearied in spirits . [Mine]142-miss fairfax , [I]79-emma confess , are exhausted . The greatest kindness [you]81-mr. woodhouse can shew [me]79-emma , will be to let [me]79-emma have [my]79-emma own way , and only say that [I]79-emma am gone when it is necessary . ”[79-emma] [Emma]79-emma had not another word to oppose . [Her]79-emma parting look was grateful — and [her]79-emma parting words , “ Oh ! [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield , the comfort of being sometimes alone!”—seemed[79-emma] to burst from an overcharged heart , and to describe somewhat of the continual endurance to be practised by [her]79-emma , even towards [some of those who loved [her]79-emma best]2556-some of those who loved her best . “ Such [a home]4528-a home , indeed ! such [an aunt]5170-an aunt ! ”[79-emma] said [Emma]79-emma , as [she]79-emma turned back into [the hall]1685-the hall again . “ [I]142-miss fairfax do pity [you]79-emma . And the more sensibility [you]79-emma betray of [their]2558-they just horrors , the more [I]142-miss fairfax shall like [you]79-emma . ”[142-miss fairfax] [Jane]142-miss fairfax had not been gone a quarter of an hour , and [they]2558-they had only accomplished some views of [St. Mark ’s Place]66-st. mark ’s place , [Venice]67-venice , when [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill entered [the room]3386-the room . [Emma]79-emma had not been thinking of [him]98-frank churchill , [she]79-emma had forgotten to think of [him]98-frank churchill — but [she]79-emma was very glad to see [him]98-frank churchill . [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston would be at ease . [The black mare]2560-the black mare was blameless ; [they]2558-they were right who had named [Mrs. Churchill]94-mrs. churchill as the cause . [He]98-frank churchill had been detained by a temporary increase of illness in [her]94-mrs. churchill ; a nervous seizure , which had lasted some hours — and [he]98-frank churchill had quite given up every thought of coming , till very late;—and had [he]98-frank churchill known how hot a ride [he]98-frank churchill should have , and how late , with all [his]98-frank churchill hurry , [he]98-frank churchill must be , [he]98-frank churchill believed [he]98-frank churchill should not have come at all . The heat was excessive ; [he]98-frank churchill had never suffered any thing like it — almost wished [he]98-frank churchill had staid at [home]3258-home — nothing killed [him]98-frank churchill like heat — [he]98-frank churchill could bear any degree of cold , etc . , but heat was intolerable — and [he]98-frank churchill sat down , at the greatest possible distance from the slight remains of [Mr. Woodhouse]81-mr. woodhouse ’s fire , looking very deplorable . “ [You]98-frank churchill will soon be cooler , if [you]98-frank churchill sit still , ”[79-emma] said [Emma]79-emma . “ As soon as [I]79-emma am cooler [I]79-emma shall go back again . [I]79-emma could very ill be spared — but such a point had been made of [my]79-emma coming ! [You]98-frank churchill will all be going soon [I]79-emma suppose ; [the whole party]3782-the whole party breaking up . [I]79-emma met one as [I]79-emma came — Madness in such weather!—absolute madness ! ”[79-emma] [Emma]79-emma listened , and looked , and soon perceived that [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill ’s state might be best defined by the expressive phrase of being out of humour . [Some people]3167-some people were always cross when [they]3167-some people were hot . Such might be [his]98-frank churchill constitution ; and as [she]79-emma knew that eating and drinking were often the cure of such incidental complaints , [she]79-emma recommended [his]98-frank churchill taking some refreshment ; [he]98-frank churchill would find abundance of every thing in [the dining - room]1889-the dining - room — and [she]79-emma humanely pointed out the door . “ No — [he]98-frank churchill should not eat . [He]98-frank churchill was not hungry ; it would only make [him]98-frank churchill hotter . ”[79-emma] In two minutes , however , [he]98-frank churchill relented in [his]98-frank churchill own favour ; and muttering something about spruce - beer , walked off . [Emma]79-emma returned all [her]79-emma attention to [[her]79-emma father]415-her father , saying in secret — “ [I]79-emma am glad [I]79-emma have done being in love with [him]98-frank churchill . [I]79-emma should not like [a man who is so soon discomposed by a hot morning]5172-a man who is so soon discomposed by a hot morning . [Harriet]107-harriet ’s sweet easy temper will not mind it . ”[79-emma] [He]98-frank churchill was gone long enough to have had a very comfortable meal , and came back all the better — grown quite cool — and , with good manners , like [himself]98-frank churchill — able to draw a chair close to [them]2565-i , take an interest in [their]2565-i employment ; and regret , in a reasonable way , that [he]98-frank churchill should be so late . [He]98-frank churchill was not in [his]98-frank churchill best spirits , but seemed trying to improve [them]2565-i ; and , at last , made [himself]98-frank churchill talk nonsense very agreeably . [They]2566-they were looking over views in [Swisserland]68-swisserland . “ As soon as [[my]98-frank churchill aunt]4280-my aunt gets well , [I]98-frank churchill shall go abroad , ”[98-frank churchill] said [he]98-frank churchill . “ [I]98-frank churchill shall never be easy till [I]98-frank churchill have seen some of [these places]5174-these places . [[Your]5175-you uncle]5176-your uncle and [aunt]1419-aunt will never allow [you]5175-you to leave [England]38-england . ”[2565-i] “ [They]5178-they may be induced to go too . A warm climate may be prescribed for [her]1419-aunt . [I]2565-i have more than half an expectation of [[our]5179-our all]5180-our all going [abroad]5181-abroad . [I]2565-i assure [you]5175-you [I]2565-i have . [I]2565-i feel a strong persuasion , this morning , that [I]2565-i shall soon be abroad . [I]2565-i ought to travel . [I]2565-i am tired of doing nothing . [I]2565-i want a change . [I]2565-i am serious , [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield , whatever [your]5175-you penetrating eyes may fancy — [I]2565-i am sick of [England]38-england — and would leave it to - morrow , if [I]2565-i could . ”[2565-i] “ [You]5175-you are sick of prosperity and indulgence . Can not [you]5175-you invent a few hardships for [yourself]5175-you , and be contented to stay ? ”[98-frank churchill] “ [I]2565-i sick of prosperity and indulgence ! [You]5175-you are quite mistaken . [I]2565-i do not look upon [myself]2565-i as either prosperous or indulged . [I]2565-i am thwarted in every thing material . [I]2565-i do not consider [myself]2565-i at all [a fortunate person]5182-a fortunate person . ”[2565-i] “ [You]5175-you are not quite so miserable , though , as when [you]5175-you first came . Go and eat and drink a little more , and [you]5175-you will do very well . Another slice of cold meat , another draught of Madeira and water , will make [you]5175-you nearly on a par with [the rest of [us]5184-us]5183-the rest of us . ”[2565-i] “ No — [I]2565-i shall not stir . [I]2565-i shall sit by [you]5175-you . [You]5175-you are [my]2565-i best cure . ”[2565-i] “ [We]5184-us are going to [Box Hill]64-box hill to - [morrow;—you]5185-morrow;—you will join [us]5184-us . It is not [Swisserland]68-swisserland , but it will be something for [a young man]560-a young man so much in want of a change . [You]5175-you will stay , and go with [us]5184-us ? ”[98-frank churchill] “ No , certainly not ; [I]2565-i shall go [home]3258-home in the cool of the evening . ”[2565-i] “ But [you]5175-you may come again in the cool of to - morrow morning . ”[2565-i] “ No — It will not be worth while . If [I]98-frank churchill come , [I]98-frank churchill shall be cross . ”[98-frank churchill] “ Then pray stay at [Richmond]62-richmond . ”[2565-i] “ But if [I]2565-i do , [I]2565-i shall be crosser still . [I]2565-i can never bear to think of [you]2567-the rest of the party all there without [me]2565-i . ”[2565-i] “ These are difficulties which [you]2567-the rest of the party must settle for [yourself]2567-the rest of the party . Chuse [your]2567-the rest of the party own degree of crossness . [I]98-frank churchill shall press [you]2567-the rest of the party no more . ”[98-frank churchill] [The rest of [the party]3632-the party]2567-the rest of the party were now returning , and all were soon collected . With [some]2343-some there was great joy at the sight of [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill ; [others]473-others took it very composedly ; but there was a very general distress and disturbance on [Miss Fairfax]142-miss fairfax ’s disappearance being explained . That it was time for every body to go , concluded the subject ; and with a short final arrangement for the next day ’s scheme , [they]2567-the rest of the party parted . [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill ’s little inclination to exclude [himself]98-frank churchill increased so much , that [his]98-frank churchill last words to [Emma]79-emma were , “ Well;—if [you]79-emma wish [me]98-frank churchill to stay and join the party , [I]98-frank churchill will . ”[98-frank churchill] [She]79-emma smiled [her]79-emma acceptance ; and nothing less than a summons from [Richmond]62-richmond was to take [him]98-frank churchill back before the following evening . CHAPTER VII [They]2567-the rest of the party had a very fine day for [Box Hill]64-box hill ; and all the other outward circumstances of arrangement , accommodation , and punctuality , were in favour of a pleasant party . [Mr. Weston]82-mr. weston directed [the whole]2368-the whole , officiating safely between [Hartfield]90-hartfield and [the Vicarage]3485-the vicarage , and [every body]3270-every body was in good time . [Emma]79-emma and [Harriet]107-harriet went together ; [Miss Bates]101-miss bates and [[her]101-miss bates niece]3833-her niece , with [the Eltons]134-the eltons ; [the gentlemen on horseback]2575-the gentlemen on horseback . [Mrs. Weston]84-mrs. weston remained with [Mr. Woodhouse]81-mr. woodhouse . Nothing was wanting but to be happy when [they]2567-the rest of the party got [there]437-there . Seven miles were travelled in expectation of enjoyment , and [every body]3270-every body had a burst of admiration on first arriving ; but in the general amount of the day there was deficiency . There was a languor , a want of spirits , a want of union , which could not be got over . [They]2567-the rest of the party separated too much into parties . [The Eltons]134-the eltons walked together ; [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley took charge of [Miss Bates]101-miss bates and [Jane]101-miss bates ; and [Emma]79-emma and [Harriet]107-harriet belonged to [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill . And [Mr. Weston]82-mr. weston tried , in vain , to make [them]2567-the rest of the party harmonise better . It seemed at first an accidental division , but it never materially varied . [Mr.]2578-mr. and [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton , indeed , [shewed]2579-shewed no unwillingness to mix , and be as agreeable as [they]2567-the rest of the party could ; but during the two whole hours that were spent on [the hill]2580-the hill , there seemed a principle of separation , between [the other parties]2581-the other parties , too strong for any fine prospects , or any cold collation , or any cheerful [Mr. Weston]82-mr. weston , to remove . At first it was downright dulness to [Emma]79-emma . [She]79-emma had never seen [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill so silent and stupid . [He]98-frank churchill said nothing worth hearing — looked without seeing — admired without intelligence — listened without knowing what [she]79-emma said . While [he]98-frank churchill was so dull , it was no wonder that [Harriet]107-harriet should be dull likewise ; and [they]2567-the rest of the party were both insufferable . When [they]2567-the rest of the party all sat down it was better ; to [her]79-emma taste a great deal better , for [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill grew talkative and gay , making [her]79-emma [his]98-frank churchill first object . Every distinguishing attention that could be paid , was paid to [her]79-emma . To amuse [her]79-emma , and be agreeable in [her]79-emma eyes , seemed all that [he]98-frank churchill cared for — and [Emma]79-emma , glad to be enlivened , not sorry to be flattered , was gay and easy too , and gave [him]98-frank churchill all the friendly encouragement , the admission to be gallant , which [she]79-emma had ever given in the first and most animating period of [their]2567-the rest of the party acquaintance ; but which now , in [her]79-emma own estimation , meant nothing , though in the judgment of [most people looking on it]2582-most people looking on it must have had such an appearance as no English word but flirtation could very well describe . “ [Mr. Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill and [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield flirted together excessively . ”[2567-the rest of the party] [They]2567-the rest of the party were laying [themselves]2567-the rest of the party open to that very phrase — and to having it sent off in a letter to [Maple Grove]53-maple grove by [one lady]2583-one lady , to [Ireland]34-ireland by another . Not that [Emma]79-emma was gay and thoughtless from any real felicity ; it was rather because [she]79-emma felt less happy than [she]79-emma had expected . [She]79-emma laughed because [she]79-emma was disappointed ; and though [she]79-emma liked [him]98-frank churchill for [his]98-frank churchill attentions , and thought them all , whether in friendship , admiration , or playfulness , extremely judicious , [they]2567-the rest of the party were not winning back [her]79-emma heart . [She]79-emma still intended [him]98-frank churchill for [[her]79-emma friend]417-her friend . “ How much [I]98-frank churchill am obliged to [you]79-emma , ”[98-frank churchill] said [he]98-frank churchill , “ for telling [me]98-frank churchill to come to - day!—If it had not been for [you]79-emma , [I]98-frank churchill should certainly have lost all the happiness of this party . [I]98-frank churchill had quite determined to go away again . ”[98-frank churchill] “ Yes , [you]79-emma were very cross ; and [I]79-emma do not know what about , except that [you]79-emma were too late for the best strawberries . [I]79-emma was a kinder friend than [you]79-emma deserved . But [you]79-emma were humble . [You]79-emma begged hard to be commanded to come . ”[79-emma] “ Do n’t say [I]98-frank churchill was cross . [I]98-frank churchill was fatigued . The heat overcame [me]98-frank churchill . ”[98-frank churchill] “ It is hotter to - day . ”[98-frank churchill] “ Not to [my]79-emma feelings . [I]79-emma am perfectly comfortable to - day . ”[79-emma] “ [You]79-emma are comfortable because [you]79-emma are under command . ”[98-frank churchill] “ [Your]79-emma command?—Yes . ”[98-frank churchill] “ Perhaps [I]79-emma intended [you]79-emma to say so , but [I]79-emma meant self - command . [You]79-emma had , somehow or other , broken bounds yesterday , and run away from [your]79-emma own management ; but to - day [you]79-emma are got back again — and as [I]79-emma can not be always with [you]79-emma , it is best to believe [your]79-emma temper under [your]79-emma own command rather than [mine]79-emma . ”[79-emma] “ It comes to the same thing . [I]98-frank churchill can have no self - command without a motive . [You]79-emma order [me]98-frank churchill , whether [you]79-emma speak or not . And [you]79-emma can be always with [me]98-frank churchill . [You]79-emma are always with [me]98-frank churchill . ”[98-frank churchill] “ Dating from three o’clock yesterday . [My]98-frank churchill perpetual influence could not begin earlier , or [you]79-emma would not have been so much out of humour before . ”[98-frank churchill] “ Three o’clock yesterday ! That is [your]79-emma date . [I]79-emma thought [I]79-emma had seen [you]79-emma first in February . ”[79-emma] “ [Your]79-emma gallantry is really unanswerable . But ( lowering [her]5188-her voice)—nobody speaks except [ourselves]5189-we , and it is rather too much to be talking nonsense for the entertainment of [seven silent people]5190-seven silent people . ”[98-frank churchill] “ [I]2585-i say nothing of which [I]2585-i am ashamed , ”[2585-i] replied [he]2585-i , with lively impudence . “ [I]2585-i saw [you]79-emma first in [February]58-february . Let [every body on [the Hill]70-the hill]5191-every body on the hill hear [me]2585-i if [they]5191-every body on the hill can . Let [my]2585-i accents swell to [Mickleham]315-mickleham on one side , and Dorking on the other . [I]2585-i saw [you]79-emma first in [February]58-february . ”[2585-i] And then [whispering—“Our companions]5192-whispering—“our companions are excessively stupid . What shall [we]5189-we do to rouse [them]5192-whispering—“our companions ? Any nonsense will serve . [They]5192-whispering—“our companions shall talk . [Ladies]1252-ladies and [gentlemen]3367-gentlemen , [I]316-some am ordered by [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield ( who , wherever [she]90-hartfield is , presides ) to say , that [she]90-hartfield desires to know what [you]79-emma are all thinking of ? ”[316-some] [Some]316-some laughed , and answered good - humouredly . [Miss Bates]101-miss bates said a great deal ; [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton swelled at the idea of [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield ’s presiding ; [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley ’s answer was the most distinct . “ Is [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield sure that [she]90-hartfield would like to hear what [we]5189-we are all thinking of ? ”[88-mr. knightley] “ Oh ! no , no”—cried[79-emma] [Emma]79-emma , laughing as carelessly as [she]79-emma could—“Upon no account in [the world]392-the world . It is the very last thing [I]88-mr. knightley would stand the brunt of just now . Let [me]88-mr. knightley hear any thing rather than what [you]79-emma are all thinking of . [I]88-mr. knightley will not say quite all . There are [one or two]5196-one or two , perhaps , ( glancing at [Mr. Weston]82-mr. weston and [Harriet]107-harriet , ) whose thoughts [I]88-mr. knightley might not be afraid of knowing . ”[88-mr. knightley] “ It is a sort of thing , ”[195-mrs. elton] cried [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton emphatically , “ which [I]195-mrs. elton should not have thought [myself]195-mrs. elton privileged to inquire into . Though , perhaps , as [the Chaperon of the party]5197-the chaperon of the party — [I]195-mrs. elton never was in any circle — exploring parties — [young ladies]3280-young ladies — [married women]4614-married women — ”[195-mrs. elton] [Her]195-mrs. elton mutterings were chiefly to [[her]195-mrs. elton husband]431-her husband ; and [he]431-her husband murmured , in reply , “ Very true , [[my]431-her husband love]1093-my love , very true . Exactly so , indeed — quite unheard of — but [some ladies]5201-some ladies say any thing . Better pass it off as a joke . [Every body]3270-every body knows what is due to [you]79-emma . ”[431-her husband] “ It will not do , ”[98-frank churchill] whispered [Frank]98-frank churchill to [Emma]79-emma ; “ [they]3270-every body are most of [them]3270-every body affronted . [I]98-frank churchill will attack [them]3270-every body with more address . [Ladies]1252-ladies and [gentlemen]3367-gentlemen — [I]98-frank churchill am ordered by [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield to say , that [she]90-hartfield waives [her]90-hartfield right of knowing exactly what [you]79-emma may all be thinking of , and only requires something very entertaining from each of [you]79-emma , in a general way . Here are seven of [you]79-emma , besides [myself]98-frank churchill , ( who , [she]90-hartfield is pleased to say , am very entertaining already , ) and [she]90-hartfield only demands from each of [you]79-emma either one thing very clever , be it prose or verse , original or repeated — or two things moderately clever — or three things very dull indeed , and [she]90-hartfield engages to laugh heartily at them all . ”[98-frank churchill] “ Oh ! very well , ”[101-miss bates] exclaimed [Miss Bates]101-miss bates , “ then [I]101-miss bates need not be uneasy . ‘ Three things very dull indeed . ’ That will just do for [me]101-miss bates , [you]79-emma know . [I]101-miss bates shall be sure to say three dull things as soon as ever [I]101-miss bates open [my]101-miss bates mouth , sha n’t [I]101-miss bates ? ( looking round with the most good - humoured dependence on [every body]3270-every body ’s assent)—Do not [you]79-emma all think [I]101-miss bates shall ? ”[101-miss bates] [Emma]79-emma could not resist . “ Ah ! [ma’am]4289-ma’am , but there may be a difficulty . Pardon [me]101-miss bates — but [you]79-emma will be limited as to number — only three at once . ”[101-miss bates] [Miss Bates]101-miss bates , deceived by the mock ceremony of [her]101-miss bates manner , did not immediately catch [her]101-miss bates meaning ; but , when it burst on [her]101-miss bates , it could not anger , though a slight blush [shewed]2587-i that it could pain [her]101-miss bates . “ [Ah!—well]317-ah!—well — to be sure . Yes , [I]2587-i see what [she]101-miss bates means , ( turning to [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley , ) and [I]2587-i will try to hold [my]2587-i tongue . [I]2587-i must make [myself]2587-i very disagreeable , or [she]101-miss bates would not have said such a thing to [an old friend]4744-an old friend . ”[2587-i] “ [I]82-mr. weston like [your]82-mr. weston plan , ”[82-mr. weston] cried [Mr. Weston]82-mr. weston . “ Agreed , agreed . [I]82-mr. weston will do [my]82-mr. weston best . [I]82-mr. weston am making a conundrum . How will a conundrum reckon ? ”[82-mr. weston] “ [Low]318-low , [I]82-mr. weston am afraid , [sir]3139-sir , very low , ”[82-mr. weston] answered [his]82-mr. weston son;—“but [we]5209-we shall be indulgent — especially to [any one who leads the way]5210-any one who leads the way . ”[82-mr. weston] “ No , no , ”[79-emma] said [Emma]79-emma , “ it will not reckon low . [I]79-emma am sure [I]79-emma do not know . ”[79-emma] “ Ah ! [you]3139-sir will never guess . [You]3139-sir , ( to [Emma]79-emma ) , [I]82-mr. weston am certain , will never guess.—I will tell you.—M. and A.—Em - ma.—Do [you]3139-sir understand ? ”[82-mr. weston] Understanding and gratification came together . It might be a very indifferent piece of wit , but [Emma]79-emma found a great deal to laugh at and enjoy in it — and so did [Frank and Harriet.—It]319-frank and harriet.—it did not seem to touch the rest of [the party]3632-the party equally ; [some]2343-some looked very stupid about it , and [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley gravely said , “ This explains the sort of clever thing that is wanted , and [Mr. Weston]82-mr. weston has done very well for [himself]82-mr. weston ; but [he]82-mr. weston must have knocked up every body else . Perfection should not have come quite so soon . ”[88-mr. knightley] “ Oh ! for [myself]195-mrs. elton , [I]195-mrs. elton protest [I]195-mrs. elton must be excused , ”[195-mrs. elton] said [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton ; “ [I]195-mrs. elton really can not attempt — [I]195-mrs. elton am not at all fond of the sort of thing . [I]195-mrs. elton had an acrostic once sent to [me]195-mrs. elton upon [my]195-mrs. elton own name , which [I]195-mrs. elton was not at all pleased with . [I]195-mrs. elton knew who it came from . An abominable puppy!—You know who [I]195-mrs. elton mean ( nodding to [[her]195-mrs. elton husband]431-her husband ) . These kind of things are very well at Christmas , when [one]475-one is sitting round the fire ; but quite out of place , in [my]195-mrs. elton opinion , when [one]475-one is exploring about [the country]3306-the country in summer . [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield must excuse [me]195-mrs. elton . [I]195-mrs. elton am not one of [those who have witty things at every body]5217-those who have witty things at every body ’s service . [I]195-mrs. elton have a great deal of vivacity in [my]195-mrs. elton own way , but [I]195-mrs. elton really must be allowed to judge when to speak and when to hold [my]195-mrs. elton tongue . Pass [us]5219-us , if [you]5220-you please , [Mr. Churchill]98-frank churchill . Pass [Mr. E.]245-mr. e. , [Knightley]88-mr. knightley , [Jane]101-miss bates , and [myself]195-mrs. elton . [We]5219-us have nothing clever to say — not one of [us]5219-us . “[195-mrs. elton] Yes , yes , pray pass [me]0-i , ” added [[her]90-hartfield husband]431-her husband , with a sort of sneering consciousness ; “[0-i] [I]0-i have nothing to say that can entertain [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield , or [any other young lady]2590-any other young lady . [An old married man]4999-an old married man — quite good for nothing . Shall [we]2592-we walk , [Augusta]192-augusta ? ” “[192-augusta] With all [my]0-i heart . Come , [Jane]101-miss bates , take [my]0-i other arm . ” [Jane]101-miss bates declined it , however , and [the husband]1356-the husband and [wife]1845-wife walked off . “[101-miss bates] [Happy couple]2593-happy couple ! ” said [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill , as soon as [they]2593-happy couple were out of hearing:—“How[2593-happy couple] well [they]2593-happy couple suit one another!—Very lucky — marrying as [they]2593-happy couple did , upon [an acquaintance formed only in a public]2594-an acquaintance formed only in a public place!—They only knew [each other]420-each other , [I]0-i think , a few weeks in [Bath]32-bath ! Peculiarly lucky!—for as to any real knowledge of [a person]553-a person ’s disposition that [Bath]4584-bath , or [any public place]2598-any public place , can give — it is all nothing ; there can be no knowledge . It is only by seeing [women]1136-women in [[their]1136-women own homes]2600-their own homes , among [their]1136-women own set , just as [they]1136-women always are , that [you]2601-you can form any just judgment . Short of that , it is all guess and luck — and will generally be ill - luck . How many [a man]548-a man has committed [himself]548-a man on a short acquaintance , and rued it all the rest of [his]548-a man life ! ” [Miss Fairfax , who had seldom spoken]142-miss fairfax before , except among [[her]142-miss fairfax own confederates]5224-her own confederates , spoke now . “[2603-you] Such things do occur , undoubtedly . ”—She was stopped by a cough . [Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill turned towards [her]142-miss fairfax to listen . “[2603-you] [You]2603-you were speaking , ” said [he]98-frank churchill , gravely . [She]142-miss fairfax recovered [her]142-miss fairfax voice . “[2603-you] [I]0-i was only going to observe , that though such unfortunate circumstances do sometimes occur both to [men]828-men and [women]1136-women , [I]0-i can not imagine them to be very frequent . A hasty and imprudent attachment may arise — but there is generally time to recover from it afterwards . [I]0-i would be understood to mean , that it can be only [weak , irresolute characters , ( whose happiness must be always at the mercy of chance , ) who will suffer an unfortunate acquaintance]2606-weak , irresolute characters , ( whose happiness must be always at the mercy of chance , ) who will suffer an unfortunate acquaintance to be an inconvenience , an oppression for ever . ” [He]98-frank churchill made no answer ; merely looked , and bowed in submission ; and soon afterwards said , in a lively tone , “[2603-you] Well , [I]0-i have so little confidence in [my]0-i own judgment , that whenever [I]0-i marry , [I]0-i hope some body will chuse [[my]0-i wife]2607-my wife for [me]0-i . Will [you]2603-you ? ( turning to [Emma]79-emma . ) Will [you]2603-you chuse [a wife]3164-a wife for me?—I am sure [I]0-i should like any body fixed on by [you]2603-you . [You]2603-you provide for [the family]423-the family , [you]2603-you know , ( with a smile at [[his]0-i father]3213-his father ) . Find some body for [me]0-i . [I]0-i am in no hurry . Adopt [her]2607-my wife , educate [her]2607-my wife . ” “[0-i] And make [her]2607-my wife like [myself]0-i . ” “[0-i] By all means , if [you]2603-you can . ” “[0-i] Very well . [I]0-i undertake the commission . [You]2603-you shall have [a charming wife]2611-a charming wife . ” “[2603-you] [She]2607-my wife must be very lively , and have hazle eyes . [I]0-i care for nothing else . [I]0-i shall go abroad for a couple of years — and when [I]0-i return , [I]0-i shall come to [you]2603-you for [[my]0-i wife]2607-my wife . Remember . ” [Emma]79-emma was in no danger of forgetting . It was a commission to touch every favourite feeling . Would not [Harriet]107-harriet be [the very creature described]5225-the very creature described ? [Hazle]320-hazle eyes excepted , two years more might make [her]107-harriet all that [he]0-i wished . [He]0-i might even have [Harriet]107-harriet in [his]0-i thoughts at the moment ; who could say ? Referring the education to [her]107-harriet seemed to imply it . “[0-i] Now , [ma’am]4289-ma’am , ” said [Jane]142-miss fairfax to [[her]142-miss fairfax aunt]1061-her aunt , “[4289-ma’am] shall [we]2614-we join [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton ? ” “[195-mrs. elton] If [you]4289-ma’am please , [[my]0-i dear]3120-my dear . With all [my]0-i heart . [I]0-i am quite ready . [I]0-i was ready to have gone with [her]195-mrs. elton , but this will do just as well . [We]2614-we shall soon overtake [her]195-mrs. elton . There [she]195-mrs. elton is — no , that ’s [somebody else]1926-somebody else . That ’s [one of [the ladies in the Irish car party]2618-the ladies in the irish car party]2617-one of the ladies in the irish car party , not at all like her.—Well , [I]0-i declare — ” [They]2614-we walked off , followed in half a minute by [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley . [Mr. Weston]82-mr. weston , [[his]82-mr. weston son]3218-his son , [Emma]79-emma , and [Harriet]107-harriet , only remained ; and [the young man]3228-the young man ’s spirits now rose to a pitch almost unpleasant . [Even Emma]79-emma grew tired at last of flattery and merriment , and wished [herself]79-emma rather walking quietly about with any of [the others]3512-the others , or sitting almost alone , and quite unattended to , in tranquil observation of the beautiful views beneath [her]79-emma . The appearance of [the servants]2232-the servants looking out for [them]2232-the servants to give notice of [the carriages]3635-the carriages was a joyful sight ; and even the bustle of collecting and preparing to depart , and the solicitude of [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton to have [her]195-mrs. elton carriage first , were gladly endured , in the prospect of the quiet drive [home]3258-home which was to close the very questionable enjoyments of this day of pleasure . Such another scheme , composed of [so many ill - assorted people]5233-so many ill - assorted people , [she]79-emma hoped never to be betrayed into again . While waiting for [the carriage]3125-the carriage , [she]79-emma found [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley by [her]79-emma side . [He]0-i looked around , as if to see that [no one]813-no one were near , and then said , “[0-i] [Emma]79-emma , [I]0-i must once more speak to [you]79-emma as [I]0-i have been used to do : a privilege rather endured than allowed , perhaps , but [I]0-i must still use it . [I]0-i can not see [you]79-emma acting wrong , without a remonstrance . How could [you]79-emma be so unfeeling to [Miss Bates]101-miss bates ? How could [you]79-emma be so insolent in [your]79-emma wit to [a woman of [her]2619-a woman of her character character]2619-a woman of her character , age , and situation?—Emma , [I]0-i had not thought it possible . ” [Emma]79-emma recollected , blushed , was sorry , but tried to laugh it off . “[0-i] Nay , how could [I]0-i help saying what [I]0-i did?—Nobody could have helped it . It was not so very bad . [I]0-i dare say [she]2619-a woman of her character did not understand [me]0-i . ” “[2619-a woman of her character] [I]0-i assure [you]79-emma [she]2619-a woman of her character did . [She]2619-a woman of her character felt [your]79-emma full meaning . [She]2619-a woman of her character has talked of it since . [I]0-i wish [you]79-emma could have heard how [she]2619-a woman of her character talked of it — with what candour and generosity . [I]0-i wish [you]79-emma could have heard [her]2619-a woman of her character honouring [your]79-emma forbearance , in being able to pay [her]2619-a woman of her character such attentions , as [she]2619-a woman of her character was for ever receiving from [yourself]79-emma and [[your]79-emma father]1389-your father , when [her]2619-a woman of her character society must be so irksome . ” “[2619-a woman of her character] Oh ! ” cried [Emma]79-emma , “[2619-a woman of her character] [I]0-i know there is not a better creature in [the world]392-the world : but [you]79-emma must allow , that what is good and what is ridiculous are most unfortunately blended in [her]2619-a woman of her character . ” “[2622-they] [They]2622-they are blended , ” said [he]0-i , “[0-i] [I]0-i acknowledge ; and , were [she]2619-a woman of her character prosperous , [I]0-i could allow much for the occasional prevalence of the ridiculous over the good . Were [she]2619-a woman of her character [a woman of fortune]2623-a woman of fortune , [I]0-i would leave every harmless absurdity to take its chance , [I]0-i would not quarrel with [you]79-emma for any liberties of manner . Were [she]2619-a woman of her character [your]79-emma equal in situation — but , [Emma]79-emma , consider how far this is from being the case . [She]2619-a woman of her character is poor ; [she]2619-a woman of her character has sunk from the comforts [she]2619-a woman of her character was born to ; and , if [she]2619-a woman of her character live to old age , must probably sink more . [Her]2619-a woman of her character situation should secure [your]79-emma compassion . It was badly done , indeed ! [You]79-emma , whom [she]2619-a woman of her character had known from [an infant]2624-an infant , whom [she]2619-a woman of her character had seen grow up from a period when [her]2619-a woman of her character notice was an honour , to have [you]79-emma now , in thoughtless spirits , and the pride of the moment , laugh at [her]2619-a woman of her character , humble [her]2619-a woman of her character — and before [[her]2619-a woman of her character niece]3833-her niece , too — and before others , many of whom ( certainly [some , )]2626-some , ) would be entirely guided by [your]79-emma treatment of her.—This is not pleasant to [you]79-emma , [Emma]79-emma — and it is very far from pleasant to [me]0-i ; but [I]0-i must , [I]0-i will,—I will tell [you]79-emma truths while [I]0-i can ; satisfied with proving [myself]0-i [[your]79-emma friend]630-your friend by very faithful counsel , and trusting that [you]79-emma will some time or other do [me]0-i greater justice than [you]79-emma can do now . ” While [they]5236-they talked , [they]5236-they were advancing towards [the carriage]3125-the carriage ; it was ready ; and , before [she]79-emma could speak again , [he]0-i had handed [her]79-emma in . [He]0-i had misinterpreted the feelings which had kept [her]79-emma face averted , and [her]79-emma tongue motionless . They were combined only of anger against [herself]79-emma , mortification , and deep concern . [She]79-emma had not been able to speak ; and , on entering [the carriage]3125-the carriage , sunk back for a moment overcome — then reproaching [herself]79-emma for having taken no leave , making no acknowledgment , parting in apparent sullenness , [she]79-emma looked out with voice and hand eager to shew a difference ; but it was just too late . [He]0-i had turned away , and the horses were in motion . [She]79-emma continued to look back , but in vain ; and soon , with what appeared unusual speed , [they]5236-they were half way down [the hill]2580-the hill , and every thing left far behind . [She]79-emma was vexed beyond what could have been expressed — almost beyond what [she]79-emma could conceal . Never had [she]79-emma felt so agitated , mortified , grieved , at any circumstance in [her]79-emma life . [She]79-emma was most forcibly struck . The truth of this representation there was no denying . [She]79-emma felt it at [her]79-emma heart . How could [she]79-emma have been so brutal , so cruel to [Miss Bates]101-miss bates ! How could [she]79-emma have exposed [herself]79-emma to such ill opinion in any one [she]79-emma valued ! And how suffer [him]0-i to leave [her]79-emma without saying one word of gratitude , of concurrence , of common kindness ! Time did not compose [her]79-emma . As [she]79-emma reflected more , [she]79-emma seemed but to feel it more . [She]79-emma never had been so depressed . Happily it was not necessary to speak . There was only [Harriet]107-harriet , who seemed not in spirits [herself]107-harriet , fagged , and very willing to be silent ; and [Emma]79-emma felt the tears running down [her]79-emma cheeks almost all the way [home]3258-home , without being at any trouble to check them , extraordinary as they were . CHAPTER VIII The wretchedness of a scheme to [Box Hill]64-box hill was in [Emma]79-emma ’s thoughts all the evening . How it might be considered by [the rest of the party]2567-the rest of the party , [she]79-emma could not tell . [They]2567-the rest of the party , in [[their]2567-the rest of the party different homes]5242-their different homes , and [their]2567-the rest of the party different ways , might be looking back on it with pleasure ; but in [her]79-emma view it was a morning more completely misspent , more totally bare of rational satisfaction at the time , and more to be abhorred in recollection , than any [she]79-emma had ever passed . A whole evening of back - gammon with [[her]79-emma father]415-her father , was felicity to it . There , indeed , lay real pleasure , for there [she]79-emma was giving up the sweetest hours of the twenty - four to [his]415-her father comfort ; and feeling that , unmerited as might be the degree of [his]415-her father fond affection and confiding esteem , [she]79-emma could not , in [her]79-emma general conduct , be open to any severe reproach . As [a daughter]5244-a daughter , [she]79-emma hoped [she]79-emma was not without a heart . [She]79-emma hoped [no one]813-no one could have said to [her]79-emma , “[2628-you] How could [you]2628-you be so unfeeling to [your]2628-you father?—I must , [I]0-i will tell [you]2628-you truths while [I]0-i can . ” [Miss Bates]101-miss bates should never again — no , never ! If attention , in future , could do away the past , [she]101-miss bates might hope to be forgiven . [She]101-miss bates had been often remiss , [her]101-miss bates conscience told [her]101-miss bates so ; remiss , perhaps , more in thought than fact ; scornful , ungracious . But it should be so no more . In the warmth of true contrition , [she]101-miss bates would call upon [her]101-miss bates the very next morning , and it should be the beginning , on [her]101-miss bates side , of a regular , equal , kindly intercourse . [She]101-miss bates was just as determined when the morrow came , and went early , that nothing might prevent [her]101-miss bates . It was not unlikely , [she]101-miss bates thought , that [she]101-miss bates might see [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley in [her]101-miss bates way ; or , perhaps , [he]88-mr. knightley might come in while [she]101-miss bates were paying [her]101-miss bates visit . [She]101-miss bates had no objection . [She]101-miss bates would not be ashamed of the appearance of [the penitence]5246-the penitence , so justly and truly [hers]101-miss bates . [Her]101-miss bates eyes were towards [Donwell]202-donwell as [she]101-miss bates walked , but [she]101-miss bates saw [him]88-mr. knightley not . “[0-i] [The ladies]3323-the ladies were all at [home]3258-home . ” [She]101-miss bates had never rejoiced at the sound before , nor ever before entered [the passage]3927-the passage , nor walked up [the stairs]5248-the stairs , with any wish of giving pleasure , but in conferring obligation , or of deriving it , except in subsequent ridicule . There was a bustle on [her]101-miss bates approach ; a good deal of moving and talking . [She]101-miss bates heard [Miss Bates]101-miss bates ’s voice , something was to be done in a hurry ; [the maid]3745-the maid looked frightened and awkward ; hoped [she]3745-the maid would be pleased to wait a moment , and then ushered [her]3745-the maid in too soon . [The aunt]3215-the aunt and [niece]1859-niece seemed both escaping into [the adjoining room]3526-the adjoining room . [Jane]101-miss bates [she]101-miss bates had a distinct glimpse of , looking extremely ill ; and , before the door had shut [them]5253-them out , [she]101-miss bates heard [Miss Bates]101-miss bates saying , “[0-i] Well , [[my]0-i dear]3120-my dear , [I]0-i shall say [you]3120-my dear are laid down upon the bed , and [I]0-i am sure [you]3120-my dear are ill enough . ” Poor old [Mrs. Bates]106-mrs. bates , civil and humble as usual , looked as if [she]106-mrs. bates did not quite understand what was going on . “[0-i] [I]0-i am afraid [Jane]101-miss bates is not very well , ” said [she]106-mrs. bates , “[101-miss bates] but [I]0-i do not know ; [they]2632-they tell [me]0-i [she]101-miss bates is well . [I]0-i dare say [[my]0-i daughter]744-my daughter will be [here]3113-here presently , [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield . [I]0-i hope [you]90-hartfield find a chair . [I]0-i wish [Hetty]177-hetty had not gone . [I]0-i am very little able — Have [you]90-hartfield a chair , [ma’am]4289-ma’am ? Do [you]90-hartfield sit where [you]90-hartfield like ? [I]0-i am sure [she]177-hetty will be [here]3113-here presently . ” [Emma]79-emma seriously hoped [she]79-emma would . [She]79-emma had a moment ’s fear of [Miss Bates]101-miss bates keeping away from [her]79-emma . But [Miss Bates]101-miss bates soon came—“Very[177-hetty] happy and obliged”—but [Emma]79-emma ’s conscience told [her]79-emma that there was not the same cheerful volubility as before — less ease of look and manner . A very friendly inquiry after [Miss Fairfax]142-miss fairfax , [she]79-emma hoped , might lead the way to a return of old feelings . The touch seemed immediate . “[90-hartfield] Ah ! [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield , how kind [you]90-hartfield are!—I suppose [you]90-hartfield have heard — and are come to give [us]2637-us joy . This does not seem much like joy , indeed , in me—(twinkling away a tear or two)—but it will be very trying for [us]2637-us to part with [her]177-hetty , after having had [her]177-hetty so long , and [she]177-hetty has a dreadful headache just now , writing all the morning:—such long letters , [you]90-hartfield know , to be written to [Colonel Campbell]153-colonel campbell , and [Mrs. Dixon]181-mrs. dixon . ‘ [[My]0-i dear]3120-my dear , ’ said [I]0-i , ‘ [you]90-hartfield will blind [yourself’—for]2639-yourself’—for tears were in [her]177-hetty eyes perpetually . [One]475-one can not wonder , [one]475-one can not wonder . It is a great change ; and though [she]177-hetty is amazingly fortunate — such a situation , [I]0-i suppose , as [no young woman before ever met with on first going out]2642-no young woman before ever met with on first going out — do not think [us]2637-us ungrateful , [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield , for such surprising good fortune—(again dispersing [her]177-hetty tears)—but , poor dear soul ! if [you]90-hartfield were to see what a headache [she]177-hetty has . When [one]475-one is in great pain , [you]90-hartfield know one can not feel any blessing quite as it may deserve . [She]177-hetty is as low as possible . To look at [her]177-hetty , [nobody]3124-nobody would think how delighted and happy [she]177-hetty is to have secured such a situation . [You]90-hartfield will excuse [her]177-hetty not coming to [you]90-hartfield — [she]177-hetty is not able — [she]177-hetty is gone into [[her]177-hetty own room]955-her own room — [I]0-i want [her]177-hetty to lie down upon the bed . ‘ [[My]0-i dear]3120-my dear , ’ said [I]0-i , ‘ [I]0-i shall say [you]3120-my dear are laid down upon the bed : ’ but , however , [she]177-hetty is not ; [she]177-hetty is walking about [the room]3386-the room . But , now that [she]177-hetty has written [her]177-hetty letters , [she]177-hetty says [she]177-hetty shall soon be well . [She]177-hetty will be extremely sorry to miss seeing [you]90-hartfield , [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield , but [your]90-hartfield kindness will excuse [her]177-hetty . [You]90-hartfield were kept waiting at the door — [I]0-i was quite ashamed — but somehow there was a little bustle — for it so happened that [we]2648-we had not heard the knock , and till [you]90-hartfield were on the stairs , [we]2648-we did not know any body was coming . ‘ It is only [Mrs. Cole]176-mrs. cole , ’ said [I]0-i , ‘ depend upon it . [Nobody else]1495-nobody else would come so early . ’ ‘ Well , ’ said [she]176-mrs. cole , ‘ it must be borne some time or other , and it may as well be now . ’ But then [Patty]185-patty came in , and said it was [you]90-hartfield . ‘ Oh ! ’ said [I]0-i , ‘ it is [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield : [I]0-i am sure [you]90-hartfield will like to see [her]90-hartfield . [’—‘I]90-hartfield can see [nobody]3124-nobody , ’ said [she]176-mrs. cole ; and up [she]176-mrs. cole got , and would go away ; and that was what made [us]2648-we keep [you]90-hartfield waiting — and extremely sorry and ashamed [we]2648-we were . ‘ If [you]90-hartfield must go , [[my]0-i dear]3120-my dear , ’ said [I]0-i , ‘ [you]90-hartfield must , and [I]0-i will say [you]90-hartfield are laid down upon the bed . ’ ” [Emma]79-emma was most sincerely interested . [Her]79-emma heart had been long growing kinder towards [Jane]142-miss fairfax ; and this picture of [her]79-emma present sufferings acted as a cure of every former ungenerous suspicion , and left [her]79-emma nothing but pity ; and the remembrance of the less just and less gentle sensations of the past , obliged [her]79-emma to admit that [Jane]142-miss fairfax might very naturally resolve on seeing [Mrs. Cole]176-mrs. cole or [any other steady friend]5254-any other steady friend , when [she]142-miss fairfax might not bear to see [herself]142-miss fairfax . [She]79-emma spoke as [she]79-emma felt , with earnest regret and solicitude — sincerely wishing that the circumstances which [she]79-emma collected from [Miss Bates]101-miss bates to be now actually determined on , might be as much for [Miss Fairfax]142-miss fairfax ’s advantage and comfort as possible . “[0-i] It must be a severe trial to [them]2652-them all . [She]2653-she had understood it was to be delayed till [Colonel Campbell]153-colonel campbell ’s return . ” “[2653-she] So very kind ! ” replied [Miss Bates]101-miss bates . “[2653-she] But [you]2654-you are always kind . ” There was no bearing such an “[2654-you] always ; ” and to break through [her]79-emma dreadful gratitude , [Emma]79-emma made the direct inquiry of — “[2654-you] Where — may [I]0-i ask?—is [Miss Fairfax]142-miss fairfax going ? ” “[322-mrs. smallridge] To a [Mrs. Smallridge]322-mrs. smallridge — charming woman — most superior — to have the charge of [[her]322-mrs. smallridge three little girls]2655-her three little girls — [delightful children]2656-delightful children . Impossible that any situation could be more replete with comfort ; if [we]2657-we except , perhaps , [[Mrs. Suckling]308-mrs. suckling ’s own family]2658-mrs. suckling ’s own family , and [Mrs. Bragge]267-mrs. bragge ’s ; but [Mrs. Smallridge]322-mrs. smallridge is intimate with both , and in the very same neighbourhood:—lives only four miles from [Maple Grove]53-maple grove . [Jane]142-miss fairfax will be only four miles from [Maple Grove]53-maple grove . ” “[195-mrs. elton] [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton , [I]0-i suppose , has been [the person to whom [Miss Fairfax]142-miss fairfax owes]2659-the person to whom miss fairfax owes — ” “[195-mrs. elton] Yes , [[our]2657-we good [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton]2660-our good mrs. elton . [The most indefatigable , true friend]2661-the most indefatigable , true friend . [She]195-mrs. elton would not take a denial . [She]195-mrs. elton would not let [Jane]142-miss fairfax say , ‘ No ; ’ for when [Jane]142-miss fairfax first heard of it , ( it was the day before yesterday , the very morning [we]2657-we were at [Donwell]202-donwell , ) when [Jane]142-miss fairfax first heard of it , [she]142-miss fairfax was quite decided against accepting the offer , and for the reasons [you]2662-you mention ; exactly as [you]2662-you say , [she]142-miss fairfax had made up [her]142-miss fairfax mind to close with nothing till [Colonel Campbell]153-colonel campbell ’s return , and nothing should induce [her]142-miss fairfax to enter into any engagement at present — and so [she]142-miss fairfax told [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton over and over again — and [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i had no more idea that [she]142-miss fairfax would change [her]142-miss fairfax mind!—but [that good [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton , whose judgment never fails [her]142-miss fairfax , saw farther than [I]0-i did]195-mrs. elton . It is not every body that would have stood out in such a kind way as [she]142-miss fairfax did , and refuse to take [Jane]142-miss fairfax ’s answer ; but [she]142-miss fairfax positively declared [she]142-miss fairfax would not write any such denial yesterday , as [Jane]142-miss fairfax wished [her]142-miss fairfax ; [she]142-miss fairfax would wait — and , sure enough , yesterday evening it was all settled that [Jane]142-miss fairfax should go . Quite a surprize to [me]0-i ! [I]0-i had not the least idea!—Jane took [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton aside , and told [her]195-mrs. elton at once , that upon thinking over the advantages of [Mrs. Smallridge]322-mrs. smallridge ’s situation , [she]195-mrs. elton had come to the resolution of accepting it.—I did not know a word of it till it was all settled . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i spent the evening with [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton ? ” “[195-mrs. elton] Yes , [all of [us]2663-all of us]2663-all of us ; [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton would have [us]2663-all of us come . It was settled so , upon [the hill]2580-the hill , while [we]2663-all of us were walking about with [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley . ‘ [You]0-i must all spend [your]0-i evening with [us]2663-all of us , ’ said she—‘I positively must have [you]0-i all come . ’ ” “[88-mr. knightley] [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley was there too , was [he]88-mr. knightley ? ” “[88-mr. knightley] No , not [Mr. Knightley]88-mr. knightley ; [he]88-mr. knightley declined it from the first ; and though [I]0-i thought [he]88-mr. knightley would come , because [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton declared [she]195-mrs. elton would not let [him]88-mr. knightley off , [he]88-mr. knightley did not;—but [[my]0-i mother]1513-my mother , and [Jane]142-miss fairfax , and [I]0-i , were all there , and a very agreeable evening [we]2663-all of us had . [Such kind friends]2666-such kind friends , [you]0-i know , [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield , [one]475-one must always find agreeable , though every body seemed rather fagged after the morning ’s party . Even pleasure , [you]0-i know , is fatiguing — and [I]0-i can not say that any of [them]2666-such kind friends seemed very much to have enjoyed it . However , [I]0-i shall always think it a very pleasant party , and feel extremely obliged to [the kind friends who included [me]0-i in it]2668-the kind friends who included me in it . ” “[142-miss fairfax] [Miss Fairfax]142-miss fairfax , [I]0-i suppose , though [you]142-miss fairfax were not aware of it , had been making up [her]142-miss fairfax mind the whole day ? ” “[142-miss fairfax] [I]0-i dare say [she]142-miss fairfax had . ” “[142-miss fairfax] Whenever the time may come , it must be unwelcome to [her]142-miss fairfax and all [[her]142-miss fairfax friends]817-her friends — but [I]0-i hope [her]142-miss fairfax engagement will have every alleviation that is possible — [I]0-i mean , as to the character and manners of [the family]423-the family . ” “[0-i] Thank [you]142-miss fairfax , [dear Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield . Yes , indeed , there is every thing in [the world]392-the world that can make [her]142-miss fairfax happy in [it]2672-it . Except [the Sucklings]305-the sucklings and [Bragges]323-bragges , there is not [such another nursery establishment , so liberal and elegant , in all [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton ’s acquaintance]2673-such another nursery establishment , so liberal and elegant , in all mrs. elton ’s acquaintance . [Mrs. Smallridge]322-mrs. smallridge , a most delightful woman!—A style of living almost equal to [Maple Grove]53-maple grove — and as to [the children]3286-the children , except [the little Sucklings]305-the sucklings and [little Bragges]323-bragges , there are [not such elegant sweet children]2675-not such elegant sweet children anywhere . [Jane]142-miss fairfax will be treated with such regard and kindness!—It will be nothing but pleasure , a life of pleasure.—And [her]142-miss fairfax salary!—I really can not venture to name [her]142-miss fairfax salary to [you]142-miss fairfax , [Miss Woodhouse]90-hartfield . Even [you]142-miss fairfax , used as [you]142-miss fairfax are to great sums , would hardly believe that so much could be given to [a young person like [Jane]142-miss fairfax]2676-a young person like jane . ” “[1401-madam] Ah ! [madam]1401-madam , ” cried [Emma]79-emma , “[1401-madam] if [other children]2678-other children are at all like what [I]0-i remember to have been [myself]0-i , [I]0-i should think five times the amount of what [I]0-i have ever yet heard named as a salary on such occasions , dearly earned . ” “[142-miss fairfax] [You]142-miss fairfax are so noble in [your]142-miss fairfax ideas ! ” “[142-miss fairfax] And when is [Miss Fairfax]142-miss fairfax to leave [you]142-miss fairfax ? ” “[142-miss fairfax] Very soon , very soon , indeed ; that ’s the worst of it . Within a fortnight . [Mrs. Smallridge]322-mrs. smallridge is in a great hurry . [[My]0-i poor mother]2679-my poor mother does not know how to bear it . So then , [I]0-i try to put it out of [her]2679-my poor mother thoughts , and say , Come ma’am , do not let [us]2680-us think about it any more . ” “[0-i] [[Her]142-miss fairfax friends]817-her friends must all be sorry to lose [her]142-miss fairfax ; and will not [Colonel]153-colonel campbell and [Mrs. Campbell]154-mrs. campbell be sorry to find that [she]142-miss fairfax has engaged [herself]142-miss fairfax before [their]817-her friends return ? ” “[817-her friends] Yes ; [Jane]142-miss fairfax says [she]142-miss fairfax is sure [they]817-her friends will ; but yet , this is such a situation as [she]142-miss fairfax can not feel [herself]142-miss fairfax justified in declining . [I]0-i was so astonished when [she]142-miss fairfax first told [me]0-i what [she]142-miss fairfax had been saying to [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton , and when [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton at the same moment came congratulating [me]0-i upon it ! It was before tea — stay — no , it could not be before tea , because [we]2682-we were just going to cards — and yet it was before tea , because [I]0-i remember thinking — Oh ! no , now [I]0-i recollect , now [I]0-i have it ; something happened before tea , but not that . [Mr. Elton]91-mr. elton was called out of [the room]3386-the room before tea , [[old John Abdy]324-old john abdy ’s son]2684-old john abdy ’s son wanted to speak with [him]91-mr. elton . [Poor old John]324-old john abdy , [I]0-i have a great regard for [him]324-old john abdy ; [he]324-old john abdy was clerk to [[my]0-i poor father]2685-my poor father twenty - seven years ; and now , [poor old man]2686-poor old man , [he]324-old john abdy is bed - ridden , and very poorly with the rheumatic gout in [his]324-old john abdy joints — [I]0-i must go and see [him]324-old john abdy to - day ; and so will [Jane]142-miss fairfax , [I]0-i am sure , if [she]142-miss fairfax gets out at all . And [[poor John]324-old john abdy ’s son]2687-poor john ’s son came to talk to [Mr. Elton]91-mr. elton about relief from [the parish]3250-the parish ; [he]2687-poor john ’s son is very well to do [himself]2687-poor john ’s son , [you]2689-you know , being [head man at the Crown , ostler]2690-head man at the crown , ostler , and every thing of that sort , but still [he]2687-poor john ’s son can not keep [[his]2687-poor john ’s son father]3213-his father without some help ; and so , when [Mr. Elton]91-mr. elton came back , [he]91-mr. elton told [us]2692-us what [John ostler]324-old john abdy had been telling [him]91-mr. elton , and then it came out about the chaise having been sent to [Randalls]97-randalls to take [Mr. Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill to [Richmond]62-richmond . That was what happened before tea . It was after tea that [Jane]142-miss fairfax spoke to [Mrs. Elton]195-mrs. elton . ” [Miss Bates]101-miss bates would hardly give [Emma]79-emma time to say how perfectly new this circumstance was to [her]79-emma ; but as without supposing it possible that [she]79-emma could be ignorant of any of the particulars of [Mr. Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill ’s going , [she]79-emma proceeded to give [them]5255-them all , it was of no consequence . What [Mr. Elton]91-mr. elton had learned from [the ostler]5256-the ostler on the subject , being the accumulation of [the ostler]5256-the ostler ’s own knowledge , and the knowledge of [the servants at [Randalls]97-randalls]5258-the servants at randalls , was , that [a messenger]5259-a messenger had come over from [Richmond]62-richmond soon after the return of [the party]3632-the party from [Box Hill]64-box hill — which [messenger]5261-messenger , however , had been no more than was expected ; and that [Mr. Churchill]98-frank churchill had sent [[his]98-frank churchill nephew]2054-his nephew a few lines , containing , upon the whole , a tolerable account of [Mrs. Churchill]94-mrs. churchill , and only wishing [him]98-frank churchill not to delay coming back beyond the next morning early ; but that [Mr. Frank Churchill]98-frank churchill having resolved to go [home]3258-home directly , without waiting at all , and [his]98-frank churchill horse seeming to have got a cold , [Tom]325-tom had been sent off immediately for the Crown chaise , and [the ostler]5256-the ostler had stood out and seen it pass by , [the boy]3194-the boy going a good pace , and driving very steady . There was nothing in all this either to astonish or interest , and it caught [Emma]79-emma ’s attention only as it united with the subject which already engaged [her]79-emma mind . The contrast between [Mrs. Churchill]94-mrs. churchill ’s importance in [the world]392-the world , and [Jane Fairfax]142-miss fairfax ’s , struck [her]79-emma ; one was every thing , the other nothing — and [she]79-emma sat musing on the difference of [woman]3428-woman ’s destiny , and quite unconscious on what [her]79-emma eyes were fixed , till roused by [Miss Bates]101-miss bates ’s saying , “[142-miss fairfax] Aye , [I]0-i see what [you]2693-you are thinking of , the pianoforte . What is to become of that?—Very true . [Poor dear Jane]101-miss bates was talking of it just now.—‘You must go , ’ said [she]101-miss bates . ‘ [You]2693-you and [I]0-i must part . [You]2693-you will have no business here.—Let it stay , however , ’ said [she]101-miss bates ; ‘ give it [houseroom]2694-houseroom till [Colonel Campbell]153-colonel campbell comes back .
